commit_message:
Enable VM communication channel for power management

This spec aims to introduce some support for network operators using VNF
that require to balance power and performance. Power consumption can be
modulated by leveraging HW power features and controls (e.g. frequency
scaling) depending on the traffic load, allowing for management and
costs advantages.

A communication channel has to be enabled at VM boot time for the VNF to
control such HW features via a power governor (agent) running on the
host.

Change-Id: Ia0677276b0cd512bec3fb5b548e7c19802f1bc56
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/53/511453/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================================== Enable VM communication channel for power management ==================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/vm-power-management This spec aims to introduce some support for network operators using VNF that require to balance power and performance. Power consumption can be modulated by leveraging HW power features and controls (e.g. frequency scaling) depending on the traffic load, allowing for management and costs advantages. A communication channel has to be enabled at VM boot time for the VNF to control such HW features via a power governor (agent) running on the host. Problem description =================== Tipically network infrastructures are designed to run at full speed and to handle peak loads at any time. However traffic levels change during the day, prompting Network Service Providers to find solutions to limit power consumption whenever full processing capability is not required. Considering the increasingly high adoption of virtual network functions and the availability power related controls in hardware available today, OpenStack is now becoming a limiting factor in achieving energy efficiency. Use Cases --------- * A network operator wants to be able to reduce unecessary power consumption and vary CPU power states in relation to the network load VNFs are handling * the DPDK project provides support for power management, with both power aware sample applications and power libraries to control CPU power consumption [1]_, operators running DPDK based applications need orchestration layer support. Proposed change =============== In order to limit the impact area and avoid Nova to provide some form of native power management, we propose that the Nova libvirt code only enables a power management dedicated channel for the VNF - host agent communication. This will be a simple virtio-serial channel with a Unix socket based endpoint on the host side and a well defined device name on the guest side. In particular this channel shall be enabled if and only if: * the VM image has power control ability, exposed via a new "hw_power_governor" image property * the host has a non-OpenStack provided power governor that can interact with the above VMs; we do not require any VM scheduling logic changes or extensions, we instead aim to leverage existing support, such as host aggregates or traits * proper cpu_policy and cpu_thread_policy have been set to 'dedicate' and 'isolate' respectively, either on the image or the flavor * the hypervisor is 'qemu' or 'kvm' In addition to the channel device generation, we also require a new libvirt related configuration option to control the location of the Unix socket file. This solution is open to multiple different implementations in terms of network applications and host agent. Alternatives ------------ Power profiles could be externally provided rather than embedded in the VNF itself and fully managed by OpenStack. This implies: * storing them as an additional image * downloading them alongside the VM image at boot time * adding support for host power governor communication in Nova; this would require either direct communication to a power governor or support to be added in libvirt While such approach can be seen as complementary and not necessarily mutually exclusive with the proposed one here, it comes with a bigger code and dependency impact. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- A power management agent must be present on the host for a fully working power management solution and such hosts discovarable and selectable for correct placement. Two possible approaches for host filtering/scheduling include admin flagged aggregates and traits. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- A new configuration option will added to the libvirt group to control the host endpoint (named Unix socket). It will come with a sensible default value, thus unlikely requiring intervention or affecting pre-existing deployments. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: mchiappero Work Items ---------- * Extend the MetaImageProps object to include a new "hw_power_governor" property * Add support for XML channel generation in the libvirt driver * Provide a new libvirt specific configuration option for the channel endpoint on the host Dependencies ============ * Changes here proposed assumes the presence of the definition for "hw_power_governor" in Glance. * A fully working solution currently requires support in the VM and the host. Such support is currently provided by the DPDK project. Testing ======= Unit tests should be sufficient, functional tests depend on external components. Documentation Impact ==================== Administration and/or user documentation should be extended to inform about the existence of such feature and related image property usage. References ========== .. [1] Power management support in DPDK: http://dpdk.org/doc/guides/prog_guide/power_man.html http://dpdk.org/doc/guides/sample_app_ug/vm_power_management.html http://dpdk.org/doc/guides/sample_app_ug/l3_forward_power_man.html History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Queens - Introduced

subject: libvirt: handle DiskNotFound during update_available_resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-31 10:16:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a5d8712a93c6af9a712af45cad925823f9669251', 'message': 'libvirt: handle DiskNotFound during update_available_resource

The update_available_resource periodic task in the compute manager
eventually calls through to the resource tracker and virt driver
get_available_resource method, which gets the guests running on
the hypervisor, and builds up a set of information about the host.
This includes disk information for the active domains.

However, the periodic task can race with instances being deleted
concurrently and the hypervisor can report the domain but the driver
has already deleted the backing files as part of deleting the
instance, and this leads to failures when running "qemu-img info"
on the disk path which is now gone.

When that happens, the entire periodic update fails.

This change simply tries to detect the specific failure from
'qemu-img info' and translate it into a DiskNotFound exception which
the driver can handle. In this case, if the associated instance is
undergoing a task state transition such as moving to another host or
being deleted, we log a message and continue. If the instance is in
steady state (task_state is not set), then we consider it a failure
and re-raise it up.

Note that we could add the deleted=False filter to the instance query
in _get_disk_over_committed_size_total but that doesn't help us in
this case because the hypervisor says the domain is still active
and the instance is not actually considered deleted in the DB yet.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Simple logging conflicts caused by the removal of _LI
and _LW during Pike.

Change-Id: Icec2769bf42455853cbe686fb30fda73df791b25
Closes-Bug: #1662867

commit_message:
libvirt: handle DiskNotFound during update_available_resource

The update_available_resource periodic task in the compute manager
eventually calls through to the resource tracker and virt driver
get_available_resource method, which gets the guests running on
the hypervisor, and builds up a set of information about the host.
This includes disk information for the active domains.

However, the periodic task can race with instances being deleted
concurrently and the hypervisor can report the domain but the driver
has already deleted the backing files as part of deleting the
instance, and this leads to failures when running "qemu-img info"
on the disk path which is now gone.

When that happens, the entire periodic update fails.

This change simply tries to detect the specific failure from
'qemu-img info' and translate it into a DiskNotFound exception which
the driver can handle. In this case, if the associated instance is
undergoing a task state transition such as moving to another host or
being deleted, we log a message and continue. If the instance is in
steady state (task_state is not set), then we consider it a failure
and re-raise it up.

Note that we could add the deleted=False filter to the instance query
in _get_disk_over_committed_size_total but that doesn't help us in
this case because the hypervisor says the domain is still active
and the instance is not actually considered deleted in the DB yet.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts due to the substantial refactoring of
_get_instance_disk_info via I9616a602ee0605f7f1dc1f47b6416f01895e025b
and removal of _LW etc during Pike,

Change-Id: Icec2769bf42455853cbe686fb30fda73df791b25
Closes-Bug: #1662867
(cherry picked from commit 5f16e714f58336344752305f94451e7c7c55742c)
(cherry picked from commit 5a4c6913a37f912489543abd5e12a54feeeb89e2)
(cherry picked from commit d251b95083731829ba104dc5c7f642dd5097d510)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/571432/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # this means we hit prlimits, make the exception more specific if exp.exit_code == -9:

commit_message:
Bump minor version of mariadb

This bumps the mariadb version, by adding a new repo.
As the package state is by default to "latest", the
addition of the new repo will trigger an upgrade
of the mariadb version.

Change-Id: I43e6cde7e83f62ec8fe0bb7d487c911382f6033b

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

The nova-powervm project uses Nova's lower-constraints.txt file; it
doesn't need its own.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I637abb9624bf237ef2e1e70bf40bb1d64e77d354
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix listener update race with default pool removal
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-05 08:48:42.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/common/data_models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/a5a86a141c8bcc828c961f025ca05fdb6ae394fe', 'message': 'Fix listener update race with default pool removal

If the listener-api code updates the DB before the controller-worker
code for the update executes (this seems very common) and the update is
removing a default pool, then the pool is already gone from the object
before we get to that point in the amp-driver.

Change-Id: If06141ef2328608c019594852a3ded3872b8a51d
(cherry picked from commit 1bcd5ef4b28eb022d520b0eb15ad6750c6bf02fb)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix listener update race with default pool removal

If the listener-api code updates the DB before the controller-worker
code for the update executes (this seems very common) and the update is
removing a default pool, then the pool is already gone from the object
before we get to that point in the amp-driver.

Change-Id: If06141ef2328608c019594852a3ded3872b8a51d
(cherry picked from commit 1bcd5ef4b28eb022d520b0eb15ad6750c6bf02fb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/10/572310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if old_pool in self.pools: self.pools.remove(old_pool) if self in old_pool.listeners: old_pool.listeners.remove(self)

commit_message:
Fix upgrade scripts for missing OVS functions

OVS 2.9 introduced several workarounds for upgrade. These functions
weren't properly included into the generated scripts.

Change-Id: I823c9e3db9b065fddd297e6bbdd1b51a9c7501d1
Resolves: rhbz#1582332
Closes-Bug: #1773822

subject: Add StarlingX repos
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-19 07:22:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/64864765ff8df19e15affa156c8a7098f268ce21', 'message': "Add StarlingX repos

WIP - needs upstream repo URLs

StarlingX is the open source release of WindRiver's (WRS) Titanium Cloud.
Titanium is a turnkey cloud deployment based around CentOS, OpenStack, Ceph
and libvirt+Qemu.  It is highly tuned for edge network performance and
commercially aimed at telco and industrial deployments.

There are two groups of git repos associated with StarlingX:
* new projects that provide services such as high availability, fault
  management, installation/upgrades/patching
* modifications to upstream projects that have not been merged by the
  upstream projects

StarlingX repos
stx-clients - client libraries
stx-config - Configuration Management
stx-fault - Fault Management
stx-gplv2 - GPLv2 licensed upstream packages
stx-gplv3 - GPLv3 licensed upstream packages
stx-gui - Horizon plugins for new services
stx-ha - High Availability/Service Management
stx-integ - Integration and packaging
stx-metal - Bare Metal Management
stx-nfv - NFVI Orchestration
stx-root - build tools
stx-update - Installation/Update/Patching
stx-upstream - Upstream packages
stx-utils - utilities, logging

stx-ceph

provide quality-of-service and low-latency network performance with

industrial edge deployments.

There are two groups of git repos associated with StarlingX:
* New projects that provide services and REST APIs to support services
  such as high availability, fault management,
  installation/upgrades/patching, backup and restore.
* Modifications to upstream projects that have not yet been merged
  by those projects.  The goal is to reduce these patches to zero,
  the reality is there are likely some to be carried for a time
  longer than we like.

commit_message:
Add StarlingX repos

StarlingX is the open source release of Wind River's (WRS) Titanium
Cloud.  Titanium is an integrated virtualization platform based
around OpenStack, Ceph, libvirt+Qemu and CentOS.  It is tuned to
provide quality-of-service and low-latency network performance with
carrier-grade service uptime, commercially aimed at telco and
industrial edge deployments.

These repos are new projects that provide services and REST APIs to
support services such as high availability, fault management,
installation/upgrades/patching, backup and restore.

Additional background and Q&A is in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/stx-faq

StarlingX repos
stx-clients - client libraries
stx-config - Configuration Management
stx-fault - Fault Management
stx-gplv2 - GPLv2 licensed upstream packages
stx-gplv3 - GPLv3 licensed upstream packages
stx-gui - Horizon plugins for new services
stx-ha - High Availability/Service Management
stx-integ - Integration and packaging
stx-manifest - source manifest to manage the repositories
stx-metal - Bare Metal Management
stx-nfv - NFVI Orchestration
stx-root - build source tree root
stx-tools - build tools
stx-update - Installation/Update/Patching
stx-upstream - Upstream packages
stx-utils - utilities, logging
stx-tis-repo - build support

Story: 2002123
Change-Id: I6137abc6c967cf69d69c7643eb227d54acb37f37

commit_message:
(do-not-merge!) hack to point to neutron-lib git

This is a hack to allow testing changes stacked on this one
with neutron-lib change Id5aea04553b78dd17fca85de88cf076b42d24140.

The Depends-On magic does not work when neutron-lib is not
declared in zuul job 'required-projects' attribute.

Change-Id: I2ff5123e50e29804b8bf454be4b3a08a1f37dd92

commit_message:
Create distutils cfg before install and build

Some old Python2 pip sources still use setup.py, so when you provide
your own index sources via repo_build_pip_default_index the 'Download
requirement pip sources' task might fail while trying to reach a
default external PyPI index URL.

Change-Id: Ib7d2a9aee9b13f38b73136f22f0b51e766c8dd10
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build refs/changes/11/572411/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change a validation in creating a server group

Change a schema check in creating a server group to
avoid creating a server group with no policies.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Id46d6366b772a531b3ef3214f33a0351e12fb0fb
blueprint change-validation-in-creating-server-group
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/84/546484/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================================= Change a validation for policy in creating a server group ========================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/change-validation-in-creating-server-group Change a schema check in creating a server group to avoid creating a server group with no policies. Problem description =================== Users can create a server group with no policies currently [1]_. If users create a server with it, ``ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter`` and ``ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter`` always return ``True``, and ``ServerGroupSoftAffinityWeigher`` and ``ServerGroupSoftAntiAffinityWeigher`` always return 0. It does not make sense. So change a schema check in creating a server group to avoid it. Use Cases --------- Same as above. Proposed change =============== The type of ``policies`` parameter is a list currently. Change it to a string and set it to 'enum' values (``affinity``, ``anti-affinity``, ``soft-affinity`` and ``soft-anti-affinity``) because only one policy is allowed now. A 400 error is returned if ``policies`` parameter is ``null`` or not in the allowed values. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Change the schema in the following API. * POST /os-server-groups :: create = { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'server_group': { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'name': parameter_types.name, 'policies': { 'type': 'string', 'enum': ['affinity', 'anti-affinity', 'soft-affinity', 'soft-anti-affinity'], } }, 'required': ['name', 'policies'], 'additionalProperties': False, } }, 'required': ['server_group'], 'additionalProperties': False, } Microversion is bumped up. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: natsume-takashi Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Modify a validation schema for creating a server group * Add functional tests to check a response code * Modify python-novaclient and python-openstackclient * Modify compute API Reference Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add functional tests. Documentation Impact ==================== * Compute API Reference References ========== .. [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1740123 History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Rocky - Introduced

commit_message:
rabbitmq: cleanup .DCD files during undercloud upgrade

If we don't cleanup the DCD files during the undercloud upgrade,
RabbitMQ will start with old credentials and OpenStack services won't be
able to connect to the AMQP.

Note: we only do this task when upgrading to a containerized undercloud,
therefore there is no impact on overcloud.

Change-Id: I9f8a9cecd5566f1a7ef6bd301cf57424a99a4920
Closes-Bug: #1774927

added_lines: UndercloudUpgrade: type: boolean description: Flag to indicate undercloud upgrade process is being run. default: false # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1774927 - name: Remove DCD rabbitmq files command: rm -rf /var/lib/rabbitmq/mnesia/rabbit@undercloud/rabbit_*.DCD when: - step|int == 2 - {get_param: UndercloudUpgrade}

commit_message:
Update blueprint link in default roles specification

The link for the blueprint was pointing 404'ing because it was
pointing to a different namespace. This commit updates the
specification to point to the the blueprint tracked within
keystone for the default roles work.

Change-Id: I6a22dcc81c382a7e9ce559b7bf8bda2685023b87

commit_message:
Remove explicit fsid charm config option

The charm has had the capability to automatically handle fsid
in deployments for several cycles.

Explicitly setting the fsid can lead to unpredictable behavior
when data from previous deployments remains on block devices,
and when the fsid is explicitly static across those separate
deployments.  ex. Ceph would see the fsid match and attempt to
use the block device from a previous deployment as-is and
unsuccessfully.

This primarily affects legacy development and CI environments,
which may be in place from a time before the charm autoatically
handled fsids.  The recommendation is for both test and production
deployments to defer fsid generation to the charm.

Change-Id: I0b87576810faa08a81dc2d559ef925ea02f58db0
Partial-bug: #1698154

NOTE: Changing this configuration after deployment is not supported and new service units will not be able to join the cluster.

commit_message:
Fix vcpu override var issue for logging hostvar.

loadbalancer_vm_server_vcpus is used instead of logging_vm_server_vcpus
for the vcpu override host_vars/logging1.yml file.  This review is to
correct the naming error.

Change-Id: I7f335eb8c8baf84ecc122abcba4c315512794b4a
Closes-Bug: 1775211

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-31 00:41:28.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/manager/create_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/image/test_glance.py', 'cinder/image/glance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/55edbdd8ca1455ff46fd3343d6ca2f34679efb3e', 'message': "Fix handling of 'cinder_encryption_key_id' image metadata

The Cinder code that processes Glance image metadata
is a bit confused about whether this particular field
is a Glance property or metadata.

Since it isn't a defined a Glance property and is stored
in image metadata, ensure that Cinder also tracks it
metadata and not as a property.

This mismatch prior to this fix causes Cinder to create
volumes with the wrong encryption key when creating a
volume from an encrypted image, which results in an
unreadable volume.

Closes-Bug: #1764125
Change-Id: Ie5af3703eaa82d23b50127f611235d86e4104369
(cherry picked from commit 2792be3ffced9b7faeb69fa100b3c50b76d00dc3)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of 'cinder_encryption_key_id' image metadata

The Cinder code that processes Glance image metadata
is a bit confused about whether this particular field
is a Glance property or metadata.

Since it isn't a defined a Glance property and is stored
in image metadata, ensure that Cinder also tracks it
metadata and not as a property.

This mismatch prior to this fix causes Cinder to create
volumes with the wrong encryption key when creating a
volume from an encrypted image, which results in an
unreadable volume.

Closes-Bug: #1764125
Change-Id: Ie5af3703eaa82d23b50127f611235d86e4104369
(cherry picked from commit 2792be3ffced9b7faeb69fa100b3c50b76d00dc3)

commit_message:
Fix listing of instances above API max_limit

Output of `nova list` command contained only `max_limit` entries even
when there were more. The list needs to be obtained in multiple
requests and the paging loop was terminated prematurely.

Change-Id: I4194e6d5e34ecc0ac704851c08bb895e223aa850
Closes-Bug: 1743532

commit_message:
Variable node address

This adds a var similar to what we have in the galera_server role [1],
making the local node's incoming address a var. This allows the
role's consumer to define a different node address than the one used
by ansible in ansible_host.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L92

Change-Id: I30e51668545095c8f6d91902516767d7bf158202

commit_message:
undercloud: enable KernelIpNonLocalBind

We need KernelIpNonLocalBind on the undercloud to bind non local ips
among other ip forward options. This sysctl parameter was managed by
instack-undercloud but never ported to the containerized undercloud.
We need the same sysctl parameters for parity with non containerized
undercloud.

Change-Id: Idd3d432b8f7eb573d94cd56be8e05614510ebddf
Related-Bug: #1774898
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/51/572151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KernelIpNonLocalBind: default: 0 description: Configures net.ipv{4,6}.ip_nonlocal_bind key type: number net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind: value: {get_param: KernelIpNonLocalBind} net.ipv6.ip_nonlocal_bind: value: {get_param: KernelIpNonLocalBind}

commit_message:
Switch to use primary credential in volume backup tests

Not all the apis in tempest/api/volume/admin/test_volumes_backup.py
should use admin credential, some apis could switch to use primary
credential. See [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/policies/backups.py

Change-Id: Ied77f68c982f3a8445956ad1a4ea47c3795d3294

subject: Fix empty kolla_overcloud_inventory_storage_groups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-25 11:43:00.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/kolla-ansible/templates/overcloud-top-level.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/22c155349f8b45cea6eaa655ae52116630959c7c', 'message': "Fix empty kolla_overcloud_inventory_storage_groups

In some cases we may have a kolla group defined in
'kolla_overcloud_inventory_top_level_group_map' which has no kayobe
groups mapped to it. This causes no entry to be added to the inventory
for the group.  If the group is referenced elsewhere in the inventory,
then Ansible will fail to parse the inventory file.

The specific case that failed was when setting
'kolla_overcloud_inventory_storage_groups' to an empty list.

This change ensures that we add an empty definition for the group in the
kolla inventory.

Change-Id: I8e797aa6c55f8cf0cf6d52a33f213d8131581fea
Story: 2002105
Task: 19783
"}]
commit_message:
Fix empty kolla_overcloud_inventory_storage_groups

In some cases we may have a kolla group defined in
'kolla_overcloud_inventory_top_level_group_map' which has no kayobe
groups mapped to it. This causes no entry to be added to the inventory
for the group.  If the group is referenced elsewhere in the inventory,
then Ansible will fail to parse the inventory file.

The specific case that failed was when setting
'kolla_overcloud_inventory_storage_groups' to an empty list.

This change ensures that we add an empty definition for the group in the
kolla inventory.

Change-Id: I8e797aa6c55f8cf0cf6d52a33f213d8131581fea
Story: 2002105
Task: 19783
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/65/570565/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add keystone only upgrade jobs

Using featureset051 it will do an upgrade of scenario000 (keystone only).

Depends-On: Iad86a5910434c6e69eb1eaa6c51311b112ed17ab
Depends-On: I4a4e769b07e1982e83cbaec6651c215666def83d
Change-Id: I4d8ad33d5dc399a9172370663ca3aa7e93f1a973

Add OPNFV scenario environment

Add an OPNFV scenario environment that uses ODL for overcloud
networking and OVS for virthost networking.

malformed heartbeat packets. I was unable to reproduce the issue
(I suspect oslo_utils fixed the root cause), but I could see how this
could happen and our error handling could be improved.
This is a lower severity as this port is intended to be only accessible

commit_message:
Improve Health Manager error handling

It was reported that the Health Manager process could be crashed with
malformed heartbeat packets. I was unable to reproduce the issue
(I suspect oslo_utils fixed the root cause), but I could see how this
could happen and our error handling could be improved.
This is a lower severity as this port is intended to be only accessible
from a private lb-mgmt-net network.
This patch adds additional exception handling to the Health Manager
listener routines to better handle heartbeat packet issues.

Change-Id: I2da6fa394f5152148237d0986fd969b7950815ba
Story: 2001959
Task: 15081

commit_message:
Add support to deploy hadoop 2.7.5

Add hadoop 2.7.5 deployment script into vanilla plugin.

Change-Id: I8f3b4a447d8b76e5a1e3f88e1e2c7f009b433bb6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/99/561599/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Mirantis Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import copy from oslo_config import cfg import six from sahara.plugins import provisioning as p from sahara.plugins.vanilla.hadoop2 import config_helper as c_helper from sahara.utils import xmlutils as x CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.import_opt("enable_data_locality", "sahara.topology.topology_helper") CORE_DEFAULT = x.load_hadoop_xml_defaults( 'plugins/vanilla/v2_7_5/resources/core-default.xml') HDFS_DEFAULT = x.load_hadoop_xml_defaults( 'plugins/vanilla/v2_7_5/resources/hdfs-default.xml') MAPRED_DEFAULT = x.load_hadoop_xml_defaults( 'plugins/vanilla/v2_7_5/resources/mapred-default.xml') YARN_DEFAULT = x.load_hadoop_xml_defaults( 'plugins/vanilla/v2_7_5/resources/yarn-default.xml') OOZIE_DEFAULT = x.load_hadoop_xml_defaults( 'plugins/vanilla/v2_7_5/resources/oozie-default.xml') HIVE_DEFAULT = x.load_hadoop_xml_defaults( 'plugins/vanilla/v2_7_5/resources/hive-default.xml') _default_executor_classpath = ":".join( ['/opt/hadoop/share/hadoop/tools/lib/hadoop-openstack-2.8.2.jar']) SPARK_CONFS = copy.deepcopy(c_helper.SPARK_CONFS) SPARK_CONFS['Spark']['OPTIONS'].append( { 'name': 'Executor extra classpath', 'description': 'Value for spark.executor.extraClassPath' ' in spark-defaults.conf' ' (default: %s)' % _default_executor_classpath, 'default': '%s' % _default_executor_classpath, 'priority': 2, } ) XML_CONFS = { "Hadoop": [CORE_DEFAULT], "HDFS": [HDFS_DEFAULT], "YARN": [YARN_DEFAULT], "MapReduce": [MAPRED_DEFAULT], "JobFlow": [OOZIE_DEFAULT], "Hive": [HIVE_DEFAULT] } ENV_CONFS = { "YARN": { 'ResourceManager Heap Size': 1024, 'NodeManager Heap Size': 1024 }, "HDFS": { 'NameNode Heap Size': 1024, 'SecondaryNameNode Heap Size': 1024, 'DataNode Heap Size': 1024 }, "MapReduce": { 'JobHistoryServer Heap Size': 1024 }, "JobFlow": { 'Oozie Heap Size': 1024 } } # Initialise plugin Hadoop configurations PLUGIN_XML_CONFIGS = c_helper.init_xml_configs(XML_CONFS) PLUGIN_ENV_CONFIGS = c_helper.init_env_configs(ENV_CONFS) def _init_all_configs(): configs = [] configs.extend(PLUGIN_XML_CONFIGS) configs.extend(PLUGIN_ENV_CONFIGS) configs.extend(c_helper.PLUGIN_GENERAL_CONFIGS) configs.extend(_get_spark_configs()) configs.extend(_get_zookeeper_configs()) return configs def _get_spark_opt_default(opt_name): for opt in SPARK_CONFS["Spark"]["OPTIONS"]: if opt_name == opt["name"]: return opt["default"] return None def _get_spark_configs(): spark_configs = [] for service, config_items in six.iteritems(SPARK_CONFS): for item in config_items['OPTIONS']: cfg = p.Config(name=item["name"], description=item["description"], default_value=item["default"], applicable_target=service, scope="cluster", is_optional=True, priority=item["priority"]) spark_configs.append(cfg) return spark_configs def _get_zookeeper_configs(): zk_configs = [] for service, config_items in six.iteritems(c_helper.ZOOKEEPER_CONFS): for item in config_items['OPTIONS']: cfg = p.Config(name=item["name"], description=item["description"], default_value=item["default"], applicable_target=service, scope="cluster", is_optional=True, priority=item["priority"]) zk_configs.append(cfg) return zk_configs PLUGIN_CONFIGS = _init_all_configs() def get_plugin_configs(): return PLUGIN_CONFIGS def get_xml_configs(): return PLUGIN_XML_CONFIGS def get_env_configs(): return ENV_CONFS

commit_message:
Add scenario008 job to include containers

Eventually the non-container scenario008 job will be removed, but for
now it needs to stay until we update all projects that depend on the job
being there and migrate them to container version.

This is part of the work to enable scenario008 as part of check/gate:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/486905/

Change-Id: I33602ac5521c4f059c1a0d08e3e828fb64d3c817
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix logic error introduced in assess_status()

Commit 352d6993870be2547f37463e4e3cffc7605f749c introduced a change
in assess_status to not update status as long as the previous status
was 'blocked'.  This was done because the check for pristine block
devices is done elsewhere in the charm.

However there are other situations that might set the charm in
'blocked' state.

This commit addresses this error.

Change-Id: Icdc272dadd7f9ceb670d37238628d31f33d11770

commit_message:
Use inline literal markup for options in releasenotes

This commit makes the releasenotes to use 'inline literal markup[0]
because it would be accurate rendering for commandline
options. Otherwise, dashes are changed into an en/em dash entity. And
this commit also fixes some inline literal markups which I
noticed. Ideally, we should fix like that things in one
patch. However, it's a bit hard to find them all..

[0] http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/restructuredtext/basics.html#roles

Change-Id: I8f7691b3ff40ccde051620f44217dab244d76960

commit_message:
Ensure IPA CA generates CRL on startup

If the CRL is not generated on startup, we could have deployments
that fail because the CRL is not present when puppet goes to get
it.  This fix will ensure the CRL is generated at the start to
avoid this issue.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1571897

Change-Id: Ia95f78257e23f36ce35b89e0a711b713e8d1b8b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/05/571805/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## * Set CA to create CRL on restart sed -i "s/ca.crl.MasterCRL.publishOnStart=.*/ca.crl.MasterCRL.publishOnStart=true/" /etc/pki/pki-tomcat/ca/CS.cfg systemctl restart pki-tomcatd@pki-tomcat.service

commit_message:
Fix Ansible warnings for use of until with {{ }}

As for 'when' clauses, 'until' should no longer use brackets, lest you
receive a written warning from Ansible.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I1f10092ce283d288ae75600c4d0a450697b37c9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/14/570414/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: until: delete_result | success or 'is locked by host' in delete_result.stdout until: not show_result.stdout_lines[1:] | intersect(deleting_states)
deleted_lines: until: "{{ delete_result | success or 'is locked by host' in delete_result.stdout }}" until: "{{ not show_result.stdout_lines[1:] | intersect(deleting_states) }}"

commit_message:
Specify Vagrant box version

Add a line which states the version of the Vagrant box to be used when
provisioning a development environment.

NB: In this case, 0.2.0 is an image based on CentOS 7.5

Change-Id: I81613df1d20dfd1b99a5d7624fc1627ca185dd7f

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia1033404132a3d59955fca31510343b316de1458

commit_message:
Add documentation on running os-profiler with ELK

The change documents adding os-profiler overrides into an
openstack-ansible deployment which will collect notification messages
when a profile command is executed.

To ensure the best possible outcome with os-profiler indexes a playbook
to create default indexes has been added which will create the known
index and apply appropriate settings.

Change-Id: Ie00424b2d3d123d8764cd201605ea5234a78bfbb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/56/572256/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: Create known indexes in Elasticsearch hosts: "elastic-logstash[0]" become: true vars_files: - vars/variables.yml environment: "{{ deployment_environment_variables | default({}) }}" tasks: - name: Create basic indexes uri: url: http://127.0.0.1:9200/{{ item.name }} method: PUT body: "{{ item.index_options | to_json }}" status_code: 200,400 body_format: json with_items: - name: "osprofiler-notifications" index_options: settings: index: codec: "best_compression" mapping: total_fields: limit: "10000" refresh_interval: "5s" number_of_replicas: "1"

commit_message:
Explicitly use django_nose.NoseTestSuiteRunner

Horizon is going to switch to Django Test Runner [1].
To not break Sahara Dashboard we need to use Nose Test Runner
until we'll be ready to remove Nose from sahara-dashboard.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544296/

Change-Id: Ic248f7cc716ea0cfe8a6398438efa0a39228db85

commit_message:
Fix precreated ports recovery after pod annotations change

This patch ensure the precreated ports can be recovered upon
kuryr-controller reboot after the pod annotations format has been
changed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/471012/

It will ensure to tag as used ports all the port ids associated to
each pod.

Closes-Bug: 1774997

Change-Id: I08496b27238bbc3c8795068237a57666b231e0e2

commit_message:
Add 'numa-aware-vswitches' spec

Change-Id: I23b93e9f3709ca2567ee13699f694c84f3af6271
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/90/541290/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================== NUMA-aware vSwitches ==================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/numa-aware-vswitches vSwitches such as OVS-DPDK allow binding to physical NICs, usually connected via PCIe. These NICs have NUMA affinity which is not currently taken into account when creating an instance. This can result in up to a 50% performance drop. Problem description =================== In :doc:`/specs/kilo/implemented/input-output-based-numa-scheduling`, nova tackled the problem of NUMA affinity for PCIe devices when using the libvirt driver. This was done by utilizing the NUMA information for these PCIe devices that was provided by libvirt. However, the use of vSwitch solutions complicates matters. In these cases, we do not pass through entire PCI devices or virtual functions but rather a VIF object. The issues raised by NUMA affinity are still present though and still need to be addressed. Use Cases --------- * As a user, I want to ensure I'm getting the maximum benefit from my highly tuned, high-performance vSwitch solution * As an operator, I don't want to revert to custom hacks like dynamically adjusting ``vcpu_pin_set`` just so I can deliver the performance my customers demand. Proposed change =============== We add a new configuration option, ``[pci] neutron_bridge_mappings``, which define a mapping for neutron bridges to the physical PCI devices that are used. For example:: [pci] neutron_bridge_mappings = [('mgmt', 'MyNIC'), ...] where ``MyNIC`` is the name of an alias defined in ``[pci] alias``. This allows us to harness the functionality we already have in-place for PCI-NUMA affinity, including things like :doc:`/specs/queens/approved/share-pci-between-numa-nodes`, with minimal changes to nova and no changes to neutron. The configuration of this attribute would be left to the user or, more realistically, the deployment tool. Alternatives ------------ There are multiple possible solutions to this issue of various levels of complexity. We could store the static bridge-PCI device mapping in neutron instead and pass this over the wire as part of the VIF request. As neutron is responsible for all things network'y, storing this information in nova might appear to break the separation of concerns between the two services. However, this is only partially true. While neutron is responsible for creating network elements such as ports and bridges, it is nova that is responsible for wiring them up to instances. An even more elaborate alternative would be dynamically generate this information in neutron, rather than hardcoding it in either nova or neutron. This would appear to incur the least amount of effort on a deployers side and would seem like the most intelligent thing to do. However, this is not perfect either. Implementing this functionality would require changes to nearly every backend in neutron and may not even be possible for some backends if the vSwitch does not provide a way to extract the bridge-PCI mapping information at runtime. In addition, we have access to the bridge-PCI device mapping information as deployment time, and discarding that in favour of dynamic generation introduces unnecessary magic to the formula. Finally, we could take variants of both of the above and report this NUMA information to placement itself. This hasn't been fully evaluated but at first glance it would not solve any of the problems with either solution and would appear to offer no improvement over simply passing this information as part of the response from neutron. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- Deployment tooling will need to be enhanced to configure the bridge-PCI mapping configuration option at deployment time. Performance Impact ------------------ There will be a negligible increase in the time take to schedule an instance on account of the additional NUMA affinity checks. However, network performance of some vSwitch solutions (OVS-DPDK, for example) will increase by up to 100%. Other deployer impact --------------------- Deployment tooling will need to be enhanced to configure the bridge-PCI mapping configuration option at deployment time. Developer impact ---------------- This change will only target the libvirt driver. Additional drivers do not currently provide sufficient awareness of host NUMA information for this change to be incorporated in a meaningful manner. If this changes in the future, the feature may need to be extended to support other types of PCI device. Upgrade impact -------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: stephenfinucane Work Items ---------- #. Add support for the new configuration option #. Parse the configuration option and use it at scheduling time Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= This will need to be tested in a third-party CI due to the reliance on hardware. Documentation Impact ==================== A new document will be added to describe configuration of the option and the benefits of said configuration. References ========== None. History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Rocky - Introduced

subject: Allow cinderv2 endpoints within the request context catalog
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-04 21:46:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/11e1ae8b15ae5cc9c3b5df27c5223ad97fb4f009', 'message': 'Allow cinderv2 endpoints within the request context catalog

This partially reverts commit a03976ee892333720b2227f607a5ddbb77163fea.

This change will ensure cinderv2 endpoints are still provided by Queens
n-api control services to Pike n-cpu computes during an upgrade.
Allowing these older computes to continue to interact with Cinder prior
to upgrading to Queens and moving to the newer v3 APIs.

Closes-bug: #1775075
Change-Id: I45299df2bf095c12bfce5b1ac3e5460a11dd0131
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-05 09:41:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/context.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_context.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c7d87f6691bbc39daca918729b769cc2d2000abd', 'message': "Allow cinderv2 endpoints within the request context catalog

This partially reverts commit a03976ee892333720b2227f607a5ddbb77163fea.

During a P to Q upgrade it is common to have the control services
upgraded to Q ahead of the computes. During this time the Q n-api
services will provide request contexts over the wire to these P computes
where the service catalog held within does not contain any cinderv2 type
endpoints, as cinderv2 support has been removed from Nova in Q.

This becomes a problem if the P computes are specifically looking for a
cinderv2 type endpoint via [cinder]catalog_info within nova.conf.  For
example with TripleO deployed Pike environments this has a default value
of 'volumev2:cinderv2:internalURL'.

This change ensures cinderv2 type endpoints are still provided by Queens
n-api control services to Pike computes during an upgrade. This is only
required on stable/queens as we only support N-1 running computes during
an upgrade and so we don't need to land anything in R to support P
computes.

Closes-bug: #1775075
Change-Id: I45299df2bf095c12bfce5b1ac3e5460a11dd0131
"}]
commit_message:
Allow cinderv2 endpoints within the request context catalog

This partially reverts commit a03976ee892333720b2227f607a5ddbb77163fea.

During a P to Q upgrade it is common to have the control services
upgraded to Q ahead of the computes. During this time the Q n-api
services will provide request contexts over the wire to these P computes
where the service catalog held within does not contain any cinderv2 type
endpoints, as cinderv2 support has been removed from Nova in Q.

This becomes a problem if the P computes are specifically looking for a
cinderv2 type endpoint via [cinder]catalog_info within nova.conf.  For
example with TripleO deployed Pike environments this has a default value
of 'volumev2:cinderv2:internalURL'.

This change ensures cinderv2 type endpoints are still provided by Queens
n-api control services to Pike computes during an upgrade. This is only
required on stable/queens as we only support N-1 running computes during
an upgrade and so we don't need to land anything in R to support P
computes.

Closes-bug: #1775075
Change-Id: I45299df2bf095c12bfce5b1ac3e5460a11dd0131

commit_message:
Ensure that pip.conf templates variables properly

When a user provides values other than the defaults for
upgrade/pre, they may not format it in a way that pip
interprets properly. To ensure that we template the
conf file correctly, we ensure that it's interpreted
as a boolean, then make it lower case as is expected by
pip.

Change-Id: I91590665cd2d878b6b5ef92d1118610bb4a3fd84
(cherry picked from commit b9d90b5e81bcb27766bec04bb6f3794078506f82)

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

REF:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: Icc65afd5f6c0e22147b179c16d6a4fa5f47954ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/02/551802/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================== (Placeholder Spec) ================== This file is just a placeholder for the specs directory. It will be removed soon after some spec is merged. The latest spec template is found at ``specs/template.rst`` in the ``nova-specs`` repository. Problem description =================== Sphinx toctree complains if no file exists in a directory specified in toctree glob. Use Cases --------- None Proposed change =============== Add this file. Please remove later when the another spec is implemented. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- None Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None History ======= None

commit_message:
Fix validation for A/P services

Active/Passive services are running just on one node.

Change-Id: I253fe9e79b52b2dbe38119eeb5baf9cb3c396bee
Closes-Bug: 1771095
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/01/568301/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # List of Active/Passive services separated with space AP_SERVICES='openstack-cinder-volume' # check if any of defined A/P services has image on a node if [[ -n "${AP_SERVICES}" ]] ; then for _ap_service in ${AP_SERVICES} ; do CONTAINERS_PCMK_AP=$( ssh -q -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no heat-admin@${_ip} \ "sudo docker images 2>&1 | grep -e pcmk | grep ${_ap_service} | awk '{ print \$3 }'" ) if [[ -n ${CONTAINERS_PCMK_AP} ]] ; then echo "${_ip}" >> {{ working_dir }}/AP_SERVICES_${_ap_service}.txt fi done fi # # Check for A/P services # for _ap_service in ${AP_SERVICES} ; do echo "Check A/P service ${_ap_service}" if [[ -e "{{ working_dir }}/AP_SERVICES_${_ap_service}.txt" ]] ; then for _ip in $(cat AP_SERVICES_${_ap_service}.txt ) ; do _image=$( ssh -q -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no heat-admin@${_ip} \ "sudo docker images 2>&1 | grep ${_ap_service} | awk '{ print \$1\":\"\$2}'" ) assert_image_in_file {{ working_dir }}/{{ container_registry_file }} ${_image} _container=$( ssh -q -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no heat-admin@${_ip} \ "sudo docker ps --filter ancestor=${_image} | awk '/:pcmklatest/ {print \$2}'" ) if [[ -n ${_container} ]] ; then # so there is container running on a node touch {{ working_dir }}/${_ap_service}_found fi done if [[ ! -e {{ working_dir }}/${_ap_service}_found ]] ; then echo "Error: A/P service ${_ap_service} not found running on any OC node" exit 2 fi fi done

subject: Fix handling of netdevs with underscores
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-10 08:45:00.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_provision_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/provision.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent/commit/0029d2c6a511a35303ffb0dddd353691ad9ca976', 'message': 'Fix handling of netdevs with underscores

An underscore is used as a separator between the MAC and netdev
name when setting up udev rules for Ubuntu. This causes issues
if the netdev name itself has an underscore when the string is
split into multiple parts.

The solution is to split the string only on the first underscore,
since the MAC address is guaranteed not to have underscores.

Updated the unit test to match the scenario.

Change-Id: I32d68df56c733a748ad41c495fbb27f07ce36b38
Closes-Bug: 1722482
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of netdevs with underscores

An underscore is used as a separator between the MAC and netdev
name when setting up udev rules for Ubuntu. This causes issues
if the netdev name itself has an underscore when the string is
split into multiple parts.

The solution is to split the string only on the first underscore,
since the MAC address is guaranteed not to have underscores.

Updated the unit test to match the scenario.

Change-Id: I32d68df56c733a748ad41c495fbb27f07ce36b38
Closes-Bug: 1722482
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

commit_message:
Update mission statement

When the mission statement was updated[1] in 2016, we failed to update
the Project Team Guide to match. This change keeps a citation of the
original statement for historic purposes.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20160217-mission-amendment.html

Change-Id: Iee6932cb8859391fadb3f20d59958ca5dbffd8d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/96/570796/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The OpenStack mission is "to produce a ubiquitous Open Source Cloud Computing platform that is easy to use, simple to implement, interoperable between deployments, works well at all scales, and meets the needs of users and operators of both public and private clouds". It was updated in February of 2016 to include interoperability and better serving end users. The original mission was "to produce the ubiquitous Open Source Cloud Computing platform that will meet the needs of public and private clouds regardless of size, by being simple to implement and massively scalable". It originally appeared on the wiki on May 24th, 2010.
deleted_lines: The OpenStack mission is "to produce the ubiquitous Open Source Cloud Computing platform that will meet the needs of public and private clouds regardless of size, by being simple to implement and massively scalable". It appeared on the wiki on May 24th, 2010 and still captures the long-term goal of the OpenStack community.

commit_message:
Make action descriptions terse, move to README.md

Output of `juju list-action` is at time of this writing
formatted in such a way that we should keep description
as terse as possible and refer to documentation elsewhere.

Change-Id: Ib8e7a4804e696199803b9ac386da7bf02aafd465
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/54/572354/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(fnordahl): Output of `juju list-action` is at time of this writing # formatted in such a way that we should keep description # as terse as possible and refer to documentation elsewhere. # # Verify with `juju list-action` before proposing/committing # changes. \ USE WITH CAUTION - Mark unit OSDs as 'out'. Documentation: https://jujucharms.com/ceph-osd/ \ Set the local osd units in the charm to 'in'. Documentation: https://jujucharms.com/ceph-osd/ \ List disks. Documentation: https://jujucharms.com/ceph-osd/ add-disk: description: | \ Add disk(s) to Ceph. Documentation: https://jujucharms.com/ceph-osd/ \ Add disk(s) to blacklist. Documentation: https://jujucharms.com/ceph-osd/ description: | \ Remove disk(s) from blacklist. Documentation: https://jujucharms.com/ceph-osd/ \ USE WITH CAUTION - Purge disk of all data and signatures for use by Ceph. Documentation: https://jujucharms.com/ceph-osd/
deleted_lines: CAUTION - Set the local osd units in the charm to 'out' but does not stop the osds. Unless the osd cluster is set to noout (see below), this removes them from the ceph cluster and forces ceph to migrate the PGs to other OSDs in the cluster. See the following. http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rados/operations/add-or-rm-osds/#removing-the-osd "Do not let your cluster reach its full ratio when removing an OSD. Removing OSDs could cause the cluster to reach or exceed its full ratio." Also note that for small clusters you may encounter the corner case where some PGs remain stuck in the active+remapped state. Refer to the above link on how to resolve this. pause-health (on a ceph-mon) unit can be used before pausing a ceph-osd unit to stop the cluster rebalancing the data off this ceph-osd unit. pause-health sets 'noout' on the cluster such that it will not try to rebalance the data accross the remaining units. It is up to the user of the charm to determine whether pause-health should be used as it depends on whether the osd is being paused for maintenance or to remove it from the cluster completely. Set the local osd units in the charm to 'in'. Note that the pause option does NOT stop the osd processes. List disks . The 'disks' key is populated with block devices that are known by udev, are not mounted and not mentioned in 'osd-journal' configuration option. . The 'blacklist' key is populated with osd-devices in the blacklist stored in the local kv store of this specific unit. . The 'non-pristine' key is populated with block devices that are known by udev, are not mounted, not mentioned in 'osd-journal' configuration option and are currently not eligible for use because of presence of foreign data. add-disk: description: Add disk(s) to Ceph Add disk(s) to blacklist. Blacklisted disks will not be initialized for use with Ceph even if listed in the application level osd-devices configuration option. . The current blacklist can be viewed with list-disks action. . NOTE: This action and blacklist will not have any effect on already initialized disks. description: Remove disk(s) from blacklist. Purge disk of all data and signatures for use by Ceph . This action can be necessary in cases where a Ceph cluster is being redeployed as the charm defaults to skipping disks that look like Ceph devices in order to preserve data. In order to forcibly redeploy, the admin is required to perform this action for each disk to be re-consumed. . In addition to triggering this action, it is required to pass an additional parameter option of `i-really-mean-it` to ensure that the administrator is aware that this *will* cause data loss on the specified device(s)

commit_message:
Use subunit and stestr API more

avoid running subunit/subunit-trace/testr commands via
subprocess,
and instead use subunit and stestr Python API
when running ostestr with --pdb or --subunit

This also finally decouples ostestr from testr by not
actually relying on it any more.

Change-Id: I10fd7d1769651a54b74b4ffe7f23babc708dbd2a
Partial-Bug: #1721510
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-testr refs/changes/52/509752/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Validate Popen was called four times: # testr init, subunit run, testr load, subunit-trace self.assertEqual(4, count, 'Popen was called %s' ' instead of 4 times' % count) function = ['testr', 'init'] self.assertIn(function, called[0][0], msg % 'testr load') self.assertIn(function, called[1][0], msg % 'subunit.run') self.assertIn(function, called[2][0], msg % 'testr load') self.assertIn(function, called[3][0], msg % 'subunit-trace') # Validate Popen was called twice: # once for testr init, second time for actual testr load self.assertEqual(2, count, 'Popen was called more than twice')
deleted_lines: # Validate Popen was called three times self.assertEqual(3, count, 'Popen was called %s' ' instead of 3 times' % count) self.assertIn(function, called[0][0], msg % 'subunit.run') self.assertIn(function, called[1][0], msg % 'testr load') self.assertIn(function, called[2][0], msg % 'subunit-trace') # Validate Popen was called once self.assertEqual(1, count, 'Popen was called more than once')

commit_message:
Fluent-logging: Support creation of arbitrary number of templates

This updates the fluent-logging chart to support the creation of
an arbitrary number of templates for elasticsearch. This allows
for the definition of multiple index mappings driven via the
chart's values. This provides flexibility in determining specific
structures for indexes that may differ between log types.

This also moves to define these mappings via json instead of XML.
As gotpl can convert yaml directly to json, and elasticsearch can
ingest json directly for index creation, we no longer need an XML
helper function to generate the required configuration. This helps
reduce the number of helper functions we need to maintain

Change-Id: I3c85fb9a1e700eb1592d96f83e632172d0eb2681

commit_message:
Fix the README formatting

PyPI is now stricter about this, we need this change for any future
releases.

The easiest way to test this is by running the following command in a
virtualenv with docutils.

    python setup.py check --restructuredtext --strict

Change-Id: Icef4e712714ba861c5f5953ef7cec55844bcf43b
Related: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568881/
(cherry picked from commit 52ebdf9b44fbd994b7459e864d1d14fe1e7ca357)

commit_message:
tasks: openstack_hosts_configure_dns: Fix dnf->yum symlink

Commit 0894c91063344d2b1a80d9e29a75be17981faaed ("Trivial: Fix the pep8
warning") added the usual '---' to yaml files but this broke the
dnf->yum symlink since it appeared like this:

openstack_hosts_configure_dnf.yml -> ---?openstack_hosts_configure_yum.yml

Change-Id: Ibbb2715115e9cdcf511a4b69ca692c9c89bd110d

commit_message:
[contrib] Do not depend on non-free external style guides

The IBM Style Guide free version doesn't appear to be available,
so do not depend on any external non-open-source style guides,
per the broader community feedback from:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130562.html

As for spelling references, refer to Merriam-Webster & IBM
developerWorks (which is based on the formerly used IBM guide).

Change-Id: I722959870277d50020e6bac540522abf302ad23b
Closes-Bug: #1764851
