commit_message:
Create scenario tests for amphora

This patch implements amphora tests for the Octavia
Tempest Plugin.

Change-Id: I779d92b22a23b10d834220d80fe997f5a3719bbd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin refs/changes/51/571251/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2018 GoDaddy # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import time from uuid import UUID from dateutil import parser from oslo_utils import strutils from tempest import config from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.lib import exceptions from octavia_tempest_plugin.common import constants as const from octavia_tempest_plugin.tests import test_base from octavia_tempest_plugin.tests import waiters CONF = config.CONF class ListenerAPITest(test_base.LoadBalancerBaseTest): """Test the amphora object API.""" @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): """Setup resources needed by the tests.""" super(ListenerAPITest, cls).resource_setup() lb_name = data_utils.rand_name("lb_member_lb1_amphora") lb_kwargs = {const.PROVIDER: CONF.load_balancer.provider, const.NAME: lb_name} cls._setup_lb_network_kwargs(lb_kwargs) lb = cls.mem_lb_client.create_loadbalancer(**lb_kwargs) cls.lb_id = lb[const.ID] cls.addClassResourceCleanup( cls.mem_lb_client.cleanup_loadbalancer, cls.lb_id) waiters.wait_for_status(cls.mem_lb_client.show_loadbalancer, cls.lb_id, const.PROVISIONING_STATUS, const.ACTIVE, CONF.load_balancer.lb_build_interval, CONF.load_balancer.lb_build_timeout) @decorators.idempotent_id('6776aaa5-c4c1-4b1c-8ffb-784e4134c95c') def test_amphora_list(self): """Tests amphora list API and field filtering. * Create one additional loadbalancer. * Validates that non-admin accounts cannot list the amphorae. * List the amphorae using the default sort order. * List the amphorae using descending sort order. * List the amphorae using ascending sort order. * List the amphorae returning one field at a time. * List the amphorae returning two fields. * List the amphorae filtering to one of the two. * List the amphorae filtered, one field, and sorted. """ lb_name = data_utils.rand_name("lb_member_lb2_amphora-list") lb = self.mem_lb_client.create_loadbalancer( name=lb_name, vip_network_id=self.lb_member_vip_net[const.ID]) lb_id = lb[const.ID] self.addCleanup( self.mem_lb_client.cleanup_loadbalancer, lb_id) waiters.wait_for_status(self.mem_lb_client.show_loadbalancer, lb_id, const.PROVISIONING_STATUS, const.ACTIVE, CONF.load_balancer.lb_build_interval, CONF.load_balancer.lb_build_timeout) # Test that a non-admin user cannot list amphorae if not CONF.load_balancer.RBAC_test_type == const.NONE: member2_client = self.os_roles_lb_member2.amphora_client primary = member2_client.list_amphorae( query_params='loadbalancer_id={lb_id}'.format(lb_id=lb_id)) self.assertEqual(0, len(primary)) # Test that a user without the lb member role cannot list load # balancers if CONF.load_balancer.RBAC_test_type == const.ADVANCED: self.assertRaises( exceptions.Forbidden, self.os_primary.amphora_client.list_amphorae) # Check the default sort order, created_at amphorae = self.mem_amphora_client.list_amphorae( query_params='loadbalancer_id={lb_id}'.format(lb_id=lb_id)) self.assertEqual(amphora1[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[0][const.DESCRIPTION]) self.assertEqual(amphora2[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[1][const.DESCRIPTION]) self.assertEqual(amphora3[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[2][const.DESCRIPTION]) # Test sort descending by description amphorae = self.mem_amphora_client.list_amphorae( query_params='loadbalancer_id={lb_id}&{sort}={descr}:{desc}' .format(lb_id=lb_id, sort=const.SORT, descr=const.DESCRIPTION, desc=const.DESC)) self.assertEqual(amphora1[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[1][const.DESCRIPTION]) self.assertEqual(amphora2[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[2][const.DESCRIPTION]) self.assertEqual(amphora3[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[0][const.DESCRIPTION]) # Test sort ascending by description amphorae = self.mem_amphora_client.list_amphorae( query_params='loadbalancer_id={lb_id}&{sort}={descr}:{asc}' .format(lb_id=lb_id, sort=const.SORT, descr=const.DESCRIPTION, asc=const.ASC)) self.assertEqual(amphora1[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[1][const.DESCRIPTION]) self.assertEqual(amphora2[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[0][const.DESCRIPTION]) self.assertEqual(amphora3[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[2][const.DESCRIPTION]) # Test fields for field in const.SHOW_LISTENER_RESPONSE_FIELDS: if field in (const.DEFAULT_POOL_ID, const.L7_POLICIES): continue amphorae = self.mem_amphora_client.list_amphorae( query_params='loadbalancer_id={lb_id}&{fields}={field}' .format(lb_id=lb_id, fields=const.FIELDS, field=field)) self.assertEqual(1, len(amphorae[0])) self.assertEqual(amphora1[field], amphorae[0][field]) self.assertEqual(amphora2[field], amphorae[1][field]) self.assertEqual(amphora3[field], amphorae[2][field]) # Test multiple fields at the same time amphorae = self.mem_amphora_client.list_amphorae( query_params='loadbalancer_id={lb_id}&{fields}={admin}&' '{fields}={created}'.format( lb_id=lb_id, fields=const.FIELDS, admin=const.ADMIN_STATE_UP, created=const.CREATED_AT)) self.assertEqual(2, len(amphorae[0])) self.assertTrue(amphorae[0][const.ADMIN_STATE_UP]) parser.parse(amphorae[0][const.CREATED_AT]) self.assertTrue(amphorae[1][const.ADMIN_STATE_UP]) parser.parse(amphorae[1][const.CREATED_AT]) self.assertFalse(amphorae[2][const.ADMIN_STATE_UP]) parser.parse(amphorae[2][const.CREATED_AT]) # Test filtering amphorae = self.mem_amphora_client.list_amphorae( query_params='loadbalancer_id={lb_id}&{desc}={lb_desc}'.format( lb_id=lb_id, desc=const.DESCRIPTION, lb_desc=amphora2[const.DESCRIPTION])) self.assertEqual(1, len(amphorae)) self.assertEqual(amphora2[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[0][const.DESCRIPTION]) # Test combined params amphorae = self.mem_amphora_client.list_amphorae( query_params='loadbalancer_id={lb_id}&{admin}={true}&' '{fields}={descr}&{fields}={id}&' '{sort}={descr}:{desc}'.format( lb_id=lb_id, admin=const.ADMIN_STATE_UP, true=const.ADMIN_STATE_UP_TRUE, fields=const.FIELDS, descr=const.DESCRIPTION, id=const.ID, sort=const.SORT, desc=const.DESC)) # Should get two amphorae self.assertEqual(2, len(amphorae)) # amphorae should have two fields self.assertEqual(2, len(amphorae[0])) # Should be in descending order self.assertEqual(amphora2[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[1][const.DESCRIPTION]) self.assertEqual(amphora1[const.DESCRIPTION], amphorae[0][const.DESCRIPTION]) @decorators.idempotent_id('dd62550f-2d30-4487-9456-5f82ffcdb0cf') def test_amphora_list_and_show(self): """Tests amphora show API. * Show amphora details. * Validate the show reflects the requested values. * Validates that other accounts cannot see the amphora. """ lb_name = data_utils.rand_name("lb_member_lb2_amphora-list") lb = self.mem_lb_client.create_loadbalancer( name=lb_name, vip_network_id=self.lb_member_vip_net[const.ID]) lb_id = lb[const.ID] self.addCleanup( self.mem_lb_client.cleanup_loadbalancer, lb_id) waiters.wait_for_status(self.mem_lb_client.show_loadbalancer, lb_id, const.PROVISIONING_STATUS, const.ACTIVE, CONF.load_balancer.lb_build_interval, CONF.load_balancer.lb_build_timeout) # Test that a user with lb_admin role can list the amphora if CONF.load_balancer.RBAC_test_type == const.ADVANCED: amphora_client = self.os_roles_lb_admin.amphora_client amphora_adm = amphora_client.list_amphorae() self.assertEqual(2, len(amphora_adm)) # Test that a different user, with load balancer member role, cannot # see this amphora if not CONF.load_balancer.RBAC_test_type == const.NONE: member2_client = self.os_roles_lb_member2.amphora_client self.assertRaises(exceptions.Forbidden, member2_client.list_amphorae) # Test that a user, without the load balancer member role, cannot # list amphorae if CONF.load_balancer.RBAC_test_type == const.ADVANCED: self.assertRaises( exceptions.Forbidden, self.os_primary.amphora_client.list_amphorae) # Test that a user with cloud admin role can list the amphorae if not CONF.load_balancer.RBAC_test_type == const.NONE: adm = self.os_admin.amphora_client.list_amphorae() self.assertEqual(2, len(adm)) amphorae = self.os_admin.amphora_client.list_amphorae() self.assertEqual(2, len(adm)) amp1_id = amphorae[0][const.ID] amp1 = self.os_admin.amphora_client.show_amphora(amphora_id=amp1_id) self.assertEqual(amp1_id, amp1[const.ID])

subject: Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_deleting_project_also_invalidates_tokens
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-02 02:16:09.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/dc354e1a4a13647bc91283384a112453784e9bd9', 'message': 'Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_deleting_project_also_invalidates_tokens

The `test_deleting_project_also_invalidated_tokens` was incorrectly
routing to the server and generating a 404 due to no route to a
controller. This fix properly prepends /v3 by using .get instead of
.admin_request.

Change-Id: I4f46f1c2cac416a9052bfcbbc0084d64a9564fad
'}]
commit_message:
Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_deleting_project_also_invalidates_tokens

The `test_deleting_project_also_invalidated_tokens` was incorrectly
routing to the server and generating a 404 due to no route to a
controller. This fix properly prepends /v3 by using .get instead of
.admin_request.

Change-Id: I4f46f1c2cac416a9052bfcbbc0084d64a9564fad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/14/571914/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: headers = {'X-Subject-Token': self.keystone_token_id} self.get(path='/auth/tokens', token=self.get_admin_token(), headers=headers, expected_status=http_client.NOT_FOUND)
deleted_lines: headers = {'X-Subject-Token': self.keystone_token_id, 'X-Auth-Token': self.keystone_token_id} self.admin_request(path='/auth/tokens', headers=headers, method='GET', expected_status=http_client.NOT_FOUND)

subject: Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_change_user_password_also_deletes_tokens
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-02 02:14:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/a9b415cddf1821b2ac1d855f947a2a6fa475a6d0', 'message': "Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_change_user_password_also_deletes_tokens

The `test_change_user_password_also_deletes_tokens` test was not
utilizing .get and therefore was not getting the '/v3' prepended to
the /auth/tokens request path. This resulted in an erroneous 404
response from the server (in flask this generates as an text/html
404 instead of an application handled application/json 404). This
test would always succeed in the last step as the token was not
actually validated. The 404 response was generated due to the
lack of routing instead of the lack of a valid token.

Change-Id: I850efdbc20281e454828e40664b58a28036f79dd
"}]
commit_message:
Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_change_user_password_also_deletes_tokens

The `test_change_user_password_also_deletes_tokens` test was not
utilizing .get and therefore was not getting the '/v3' prepended to
the /auth/tokens request path. This resulted in an erroneous 404
response from the server (in flask this generates as an text/html
404 instead of an application handled application/json 404). This
test would always succeed in the last step as the token was not
actually validated. The 404 response was generated due to the
lack of routing instead of the lack of a valid token.

Change-Id: I850efdbc20281e454828e40664b58a28036f79dd

commit_message:
Get deployment_stack_id via deployment_ref for config download

When the deployment is a software_resource, trying to get the
deployment_stack_id will failed with a http stack not found.
We need to get the deployment_stack_id with the dpeloyment
links.

Closes-Bug: 1774961
Resolves: rhbz#1584951
Change-Id: I7f51a1d89ac6518d160b037615501dda745cb6e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/65/571765/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Merge values for same key from multiple services

This should merge multiple and different values for the same key
found in different services.

For example, assuming two services defining a key as follows:

  config_settings:
    mykey:
    - val1

  config_settings:
    mykey:
    - val2
    - val3

the content of the key, as seen by ansible or puppet on the nodes,
will be:

  mykey: ['val1','val2','val3']

Change-Id: I190374e36ad1a2b57611a3a9d0a52ceb1a049aff

commit_message:
Make ipmi lanplus the default in auto fencing

This commit sets the default value for the lanplus parameter,
--ipmi-lanplus, to true instead of the previous false.
This is the default used by all modern IPMI interfaces so there's no
meaning to keep the default to false, and in any case the override will
still be possible, by specifying --ipmi-no-lanplus.

Change-Id: Ic206c235f040f03d0d0334bf396864d3eeb400d2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-23 18:04:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/b9bc73536d734c32831efe7760c713a9a59d659e', 'message': 'Add probe tests to better characterize If-None-Match support

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-23 19:46:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/0b7a0fe2cba9f061545ce16838898bb7c713b2a3', 'message': "Make If-None-Match:* work properly with 0-byte PUTs

When PUTting an object with `If-None-Match: *`, we rely 100-continue
support: the proxy checks the responses from all object-servers, and if
any of them respond 412, it closes down the connections. When there's
actual data for the object, this ensures that even nodes that *don't*
respond 412 will hit a ChunkReadTimeout and abort the PUT.

However, if the client does a PUT with a Content-Length of 0, that would
get sent all the way to the object server, which had all the information
it needed to respond 201. After replication, the PUT propagates to the
other nodes and the old object is lost, despite the client receiving a
412 indicating the operation failed.

Now, when PUTting a zero-byte object, switch to a chunked transfer so
the object-server still gets a ChunkReadTimeout.

commit_message:
Make If-None-Match:* work properly with 0-byte PUTs

When PUTting an object with `If-None-Match: *`, we rely 100-continue
support: the proxy checks the responses from all object-servers, and if
any of them respond 412, it closes down the connections. When there's
actual data for the object, this ensures that even nodes that *don't*
respond 412 will hit a ChunkReadTimeout and abort the PUT.

However, if the client does a PUT with a Content-Length of 0, that would
get sent all the way to the object server, which had all the information
it needed to respond 201. After replication, the PUT propagates to the
other nodes and the old object is lost, despite the client receiving a
412 indicating the operation failed.

Now, when PUTting a zero-byte object, switch to a chunked transfer so
the object-server still gets a ChunkReadTimeout.

Change-Id: Ie88e41aca2d59246c3134d743c1531c8e996f9e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/92/476992/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python -u # Copyright (c) 2017 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import uuid from swift.common.manager import Manager from swiftclient import client from test.probe.brain import BrainSplitter from test.probe.common import ReplProbeTest class Test(ReplProbeTest): def setUp(self): """ Reset all environment and start all servers. """ super(Test, self).setUp() self.container_name = 'container-%s' % uuid.uuid4() self.object_name = 'object-%s' % uuid.uuid4() self.brain = BrainSplitter(self.url, self.token, self.container_name, self.object_name, 'object', policy=self.policy) def test_put_if_none_match_content_length_nonzero(self): self.brain.put_container() self.brain.stop_primary_half() # put object to only 1 of 3 primaries self.brain.put_object(contents='VERIFY') self.brain.start_primary_half() # Restart services and attempt to overwrite with self.assertRaises(client.ClientException) as exc_mgr: self.brain.put_object(headers={'If-None-Match': '*'}, contents='OVERWRITE') self.assertEqual(exc_mgr.exception.http_status, 412) # make sure we're GETting from the servers that missed the original PUT self.brain.stop_handoff_half() # verify the PUT did not complete with self.assertRaises(client.ClientException) as exc_mgr: client.get_object( self.url, self.token, self.container_name, self.object_name) self.assertEqual(exc_mgr.exception.http_status, 404) # for completeness, run replicators... Manager(['object-replicator']).once() # ...and verify the object was not overwritten _headers, body = client.get_object( self.url, self.token, self.container_name, self.object_name) self.assertEqual(body, 'VERIFY') def test_put_if_none_match_content_length_zero(self): self.brain.put_container() self.brain.stop_primary_half() # put object to only 1 of 3 primaries self.brain.put_object(contents='VERIFY') self.brain.start_primary_half() # Restart services and attempt to overwrite with self.assertRaises(client.ClientException) as exc_mgr: self.brain.put_object(headers={'If-None-Match': '*'}, contents='') self.assertEqual(exc_mgr.exception.http_status, 412) # make sure we're GETting from the servers that got the original PUT self.brain.stop_primary_half() # verify the PUT was rejected _headers, body = client.get_object( self.url, self.token, self.container_name, self.object_name) self.assertEqual(body, 'VERIFY') # but if we GET from the servers that *missed* the original PUT... self.brain.start_primary_half() self.brain.stop_handoff_half() # ...despite the 412 on the original request, the PUT *did* complete _headers, body = client.get_object( self.url, self.token, self.container_name, self.object_name) self.assertEqual(body, '') # and after we run replicators... self.brain.start_handoff_half() Manager(['object-replicator']).once() # ...it gets overwritten on the servers that rejected the client req self.brain.stop_primary_half() _headers, body = client.get_object( self.url, self.token, self.container_name, self.object_name) self.assertEqual(body, '') def test_put_if_none_match_chunked(self): self.brain.put_container() self.brain.stop_primary_half() # put object to only 1 of 3 primaries self.brain.put_object(contents='VERIFY') self.brain.start_primary_half() def body_func(): # Zero bytes as above, but since it's chunked we still get a 499 yield '' with self.assertRaises(client.ClientException) as exc_mgr: self.brain.put_object(headers={'If-None-Match': '*'}, contents=body_func()) self.assertEqual(exc_mgr.exception.http_status, 412) # make sure we're GETting from the servers that missed the original PUT self.brain.stop_handoff_half() # verify the PUT did not complete with self.assertRaises(client.ClientException) as exc_mgr: client.get_object( self.url, self.token, self.container_name, self.object_name) self.assertEqual(exc_mgr.exception.http_status, 404) # for completeness, run replicators... Manager(['object-replicator']).once() # ...and verify the object was not overwritten _headers, body = client.get_object( self.url, self.token, self.container_name, self.object_name) self.assertEqual(body, 'VERIFY')

commit_message:
Require the (soon-to-be) Rocky version of Horizon

... or at least the first published tarball which will lead to Rocky.
On the other side this means forcing the usage of mox as long as
there are tests that depends on it (the switch was already flipped
in Horizon, so it needs to be enabled here).

This allows us to depend on newer Horizon features, including changes
to the test suite that are useful for the mox removal effort.

Change-Id: Ibf41998cb154c5170e8038f5b2708c928b68b8b4
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>
Story: #2002037
Task: #19678

subject: Remove share_backend_name from Dell-EMC manila backends
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-16 19:44:10.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/manila/share.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/3d0451285166193337ad3ece6031e1564a82d4b0', 'message': "Remove share_backend_name from Dell-EMC manila backends

ex: [1], and doesn't need to be specified here.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-manila/tree/manifests/backend/dellemc_unity.pp

subject: NetApp ONTAP: Set new sub-lun clone limit for ONTAP driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-17 21:39:08.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1762424-f76af2f37fe408f1.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/test_client_cmode.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/client_cmode.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e0a1269d8728d8e1fa15d9c89ed7a2f90cab6b77', 'message': 'NetApp ONTAP: Set new sub-lun clone limit for ONTAP driver

Until ONTAP v8.3, the driver used to perform sub-lun clone of up to 64GB
per operation, but as of v9.1, ONTAP handles only 128MB per operation.
This new limit is causing error on volume extending operations, which
triggers sub-lun cloning when resizing exceeds max-resize-geometry.
For instance, if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, the operation
fails because it triggers a single sub-lun cloning of 1GB.

This fix sets the limit used by sub-lun cloning to 128MB, therefore
if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, it no longer fails, and
instead it will trigger 8 sub-lun cloning operations of 128MB.

Change-Id: Ib294cbdbdfe19d34a7702dafec2c8d29136a2f25
Closes-Bug: #1762424
(cherry picked from commit 029cadbf4067ad6f0bf08588cf439587f3c7052c)
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Set new sub-lun clone limit for ONTAP driver

Until ONTAP v8.3, the driver used to perform sub-lun clone of up to 64GB
per operation, but as of v9.1, ONTAP handles only 128MB per operation.
This new limit is causing error on volume extending operations, which
triggers sub-lun cloning when resizing exceeds max-resize-geometry.
For instance, if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, the operation
fails because it triggers a single sub-lun cloning of 1GB.

This fix sets the limit used by sub-lun cloning to 128MB, therefore
if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, it no longer fails, and
instead it will trigger 8 sub-lun cloning operations of 128MB.

Change-Id: Ib294cbdbdfe19d34a7702dafec2c8d29136a2f25
Closes-Bug: #1762424
(cherry picked from commit 029cadbf4067ad6f0bf08588cf439587f3c7052c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/70/569270/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ONTAP handles only 128 MB per call as of v9.1 bc_limit = 2 ** 18 # 2^18 blocks * 512 bytes/block = 128 MB z_calls = int(math.ceil(block_count / float(bc_limit))) if zbc > bc_limit: block_count = bc_limit zbc -= bc_limit
deleted_lines: # zAPI can only handle 2^24 blocks per range bc_limit = 2 ** 24 # 8GB # zAPI can only handle 32 block ranges per call br_limit = 32 z_limit = br_limit * bc_limit # 256 GB z_calls = int(math.ceil(block_count / float(z_limit))) if zbc > z_limit: block_count = z_limit zbc -= z_limit

subject: Decouple bootstrap from cli module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-04 19:22:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/01bafec7efce908f4faac75c2a75fdb9a793b0dc', 'message': "Decouple bootstrap from cli module

We have a cli command that's useful for bootstrapping new
deployments, resetting administrator passwords, creating the default
domain, et cetera. But this functionality isn't just useful for
operators. We could actually benefit from using the same process
in our tests.

Many test cases actually do a bunch of their own setup. Sometimes
they duplicate a lot of what bootstrap already provides. Other times
test modules just blindly inherit from ``core.TestCase`` to get
things works. This isn't ideal because it isn't DRY. It also becomes
really easy to tack on extra cycles to each test when things are
added to the generic ``load_fixtures`` method that is typically run
for each test.

Instead, we can try and reuse what we give to operators for our
testing. This will:

  - Reduce duplicate setup scenarios across test modules
  - Reduce extra resource creation and cleanup when it's not needed
    for a particular set of test
  - Enforces better readability if each test case assumes the same
    basic structure of data present after bootstrap, test classes
    that need addition resources should include those in their
    setUp or setUpClass methods
  - We engrain the testing of a tool we provide to operators into
    our testing environment

This commit helps us move in that direction by encapsulating the
logic for bootstrapping deployments into a reusable object that is
accessible by both the tests and the cli tooling.

Change-Id: I84c75076405e6af9356f79778f2d2e67855f4fe0

commit_message:
Decouple bootstrap from cli module

We have a cli command that's useful for bootstrapping new
deployments, resetting administrator passwords, creating the default
domain, et cetera. But this functionality isn't just useful for
operators. We could actually benefit from using the same process
in our tests.

Many test cases actually do a bunch of their own setup. Sometimes
they duplicate a lot of what bootstrap already provides. Other times
test modules just blindly inherit from ``core.TestCase`` to get
things works. This isn't ideal because it isn't DRY. It also becomes
really easy to tack on extra cycles to each test when things are
added to the generic ``load_fixtures`` method that is typically run
for each test.

Instead, we can try and reuse what we give to operators for our
testing. This will:

  - Reduce duplicate setup scenarios across test modules
  - Reduce extra resource creation and cleanup when it's not needed
    for a particular set of test
  - Enforces better readability if each test case assumes the same
    basic structure of data present after bootstrap, test classes
    that need addition resources should include those in their
    setUp or setUpClass methods
  - We engrain the testing of a tool we provide to operators into
    our testing environment

This commit helps us move in that direction by encapsulating the
logic for bootstrapping deployments into a reusable object that is
accessible by both the tests and the cli tooling.

Change-Id: I84c75076405e6af9356f79778f2d2e67855f4fe0

commit_message:
Fix unreachable 'ImageSizeLimitExceeded' exception in image-upload

ImageSizeLimitExceeded exception block [1] is unreachable in upload because
it is caught at [2] and raised StorageQuotaFull exception from there. The
problem here is that we have nested usage of the limiting reader.

To make it correct changed the limiting reader to accept
exception class as parameter so that we can pass the StorageQuotaFull
in case LimitingReader is used for quota check and ImageSizeExceeded exception
if it is used for image size cap check.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/fd16fa4f258fd3f77c14900a019e97bb90bc5ac0/glance/api/v2/image_data.py#L230
[2] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/fd16fa4f258fd3f77c14900a019e97bb90bc5ac0/glance/quota/__init__.py#L305

Closes-Bug: #1734832
Change-Id: I5a419b763bee7f983c2a94c6f3a2245281e86743

subject: Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_bad_authorizing_roles_id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-02 02:10:00.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/40f9086b6ef5f6e01895e2c2115ea9ab9b9acd2b', 'message': 'Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_bad_authorizing_roles_id

The `test_bad_authorizing_roles_id` was using .admin_request and not
actually hitting the routed controller method as .admin_request does
not prepend /v3 to the url returned from ._authoriz_request_token.

`test_bad_authorizing_roles_id` was therefore erroneously expecting a
404 response instead of a proper 401 indicating the user is not
authorized due to not having the expected role_id.

Due to the policy enforcement, it was required to generate a NEW role
to do the oauth1 workflow on, so that the user was still allowed to
interact with the controller method (which would also generate a 401,
but at the wrong phase of the data flow).

Change-Id: Ia36c2a4400c761ac78f065b332d7789ca5ce9a04
'}]
commit_message:
Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_bad_authorizing_roles_id

The `test_bad_authorizing_roles_id` was using .admin_request and not
actually hitting the routed controller method as .admin_request does
not prepend /v3 to the url returned from ._authoriz_request_token.

`test_bad_authorizing_roles_id` was therefore erroneously expecting a
404 response instead of a proper 401 indicating the user is not
authorized due to not having the expected role_id.

Due to the policy enforcement, it was required to generate a NEW role
to do the oauth1 workflow on, so that the user was still allowed to
interact with the controller method (which would also generate a 401,
but at the wrong phase of the data flow).

Change-Id: Ia36c2a4400c761ac78f065b332d7789ca5ce9a04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/12/571912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This new role is utilzied to ensure the user still has access to # the project but is authorizing an incorrect role_id for the purposes # of oauth1. new_role = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex} PROVIDERS.role_api.create_role(new_role['id'], new_role) PROVIDERS.assignment_api.add_role_to_user_and_project( user_id=self.user_id, tenant_id=self.project_id, role_id=new_role['id']) self.user_id, self.project_id, new_role['id']) body = {'roles': [{'id': new_role['id']}]} # NOTE(morgan): previous versions of this test erroneously checked for # 404 because an unrouted URI was being hit. It is correct to get a 401 # error back as the role is not in the superset of roles the user # has at the time of the Authorization. self.put(path=url, body=body, expected_status=http_client.UNAUTHORIZED)
deleted_lines: self.user_id, self.project_id, self.role_id) body = {'roles': [{'id': self.role_id}]} self.admin_request(path=url, method='PUT', body=body, expected_status=http_client.NOT_FOUND)

commit_message:
Add periodic tips jobs

Add jobs to the periodic queue that run the glance unit and
functional tests against the master of various libraries we
consume so that we don't have to wait for a release to detect
a change that could be problematic.

The dependency is needed for the *glance_store-tips jobs to
be processed properly.

Change-Id: I0385646991140debc06ea27a194a6e7f6f749e6b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571005/

subject: Don't share a network with all tenants
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 09:57:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/admin/test_shared_network_extension.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/19c367d5795e4f6c1f9a9d421e22a4cf1e5b15a2', 'message': "Don't share a network with all tenants

Other tenants may appreciate random networks not popping up for
miliseconds in their net-list; and other test cases executed in parallel
may also benefit, especially when they e.g. attempt to validate net-list
result; or boot an instance w/o specifying a port or network to use.

There is still more work on tempest tests side.

Original patch was for neutron-tempest-plugin:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550987/
and this is only backport to stable/Pike branch which still
uses tempest tests from neutron repo.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571677/
Change-Id: I88eaa1bb65482557912c2d304800d782e730a6b6
Closes-Bug: #1753209
"}]
commit_message:
Don't share a network with all tenants

Other tenants may appreciate random networks not popping up for
miliseconds in their net-list; and other test cases executed in parallel
may also benefit, especially when they e.g. attempt to validate net-list
result; or boot an instance w/o specifying a port or network to use.

There is still more work on tempest tests side.

Original patch was for neutron-tempest-plugin:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550987/
and this is only backport to stable/Pike branch which still
uses tempest tests from neutron repo.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571677/
Change-Id: I88eaa1bb65482557912c2d304800d782e730a6b6
Closes-Bug: #1753209

commit_message:
Implement provider drivers - L7 Rules

This patch adds provider driver support to the Octavia v2
L7 Rules API.

This patch also creates a provider driver for Octavia, fully
implementing the L7 rules methods.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/570485
Change-Id: I282a98a6ccb87e9ca94a0e5d47184d23cc28b253
Story: 1655768
Task: 5165

commit_message:
Implement provider drivers - L7 Policy

This patch adds provider driver support to the Octavia v2
L7 Policy API.

This patch also creates a provider driver for Octavia, fully
implementing the L7 policy methods.

https://review.openstack.org/570482
Change-Id: I242d3f40ea4bfeb0ce48f990a5fc4433638b6281
Story: 1655768
Task: 5165
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/59/567059/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: provider_l7policy = db_l7policy_to_provider_l7policy(l7policy) provider_l7policies.append(provider_l7policy)def db_l7policy_to_provider_l7policy(db_l7policy): new_l7policy_dict = l7policy_dict_to_provider_dict( db_l7policy.to_dict(recurse=True)) if 'l7rules' in new_l7policy_dict: del new_l7policy_dict['l7rules'] new_l7rules = db_l7rules_to_provider_l7rules(db_l7policy.l7rules) new_l7policy_dict['rules'] = new_l7rules return driver_dm.L7Policy.from_dict(new_l7policy_dict)
deleted_lines: new_l7policy_dict = l7policy_dict_to_provider_dict( l7policy.to_dict(recurse=True)) if 'l7rules' in new_l7policy_dict: del new_l7policy_dict['l7rules'] new_l7rules = db_l7rules_to_provider_l7rules(l7policy.l7rules) new_l7policy_dict['rules'] = new_l7rules provider_l7policies.append( driver_dm.L7Policy.from_dict(new_l7policy_dict))

commit_message:
Implement provider drivers - Health Monitor

This patch adds provider driver support to the Octavia v2
Health Monitor API.

This patch also creates a provider driver for Octavia, fully
implementing the health monitor methods.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567688
Change-Id: Ia0020690f0ef14d391c66e6b531478efc6f0d489
Story: 1655768
Task: 5165

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 09:48:59.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_rbac_db_mixin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9f72d8387ecb2b81b9e7969004ea247a948de6f9', 'message': "tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion

The test was originally implemented in this form as a tempest api test
case, but there is a problem with it being part of tempest suite,
because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and
shouldn't affect other tenants. But sharing a network with everyone (*)
briefly impacts other tenants because they see a new shared network
popping up for a second in their net-list. It is also an issue because
if we are unlucky enough, some other tenant may start an instance
without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

commit_message:
tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion

The test was originally implemented in this form as a tempest api test
case, but there is a problem with it being part of tempest suite,
because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and
shouldn't affect other tenants. But sharing a network with everyone (*)
briefly impacts other tenants because they see a new shared network
popping up for a second in their net-list. It is also an issue because
if we are unlucky enough, some other tenant may start an instance
without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

Change-Id: I199f639c95e8ae884ede46404370d7b64da3b309
Needed-By: Iba89a53b2715cf3a9c7485f2089f27d547fea308
Related-Bug: #1753209
(cherry picked from commit 6c772de103e469ad17cdbc6a86ed15655aa6b9cc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/77/571677/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion(self): network=net, target_tenant='alice') # a wildcard policy should allow the specific policy to be deleted # since it allows the remaining port wild_policy = self._make_networkrbac(net, '*') wild_policy = self.plugin.create_rbac_policy(self.context, wild_policy) # now that wildcard is the only remaining, it should be subjected # to to the same restriction self.assertRaises(ext_rbac.RbacPolicyInUse, self.plugin.delete_rbac_policy, self.context, wild_policy['id']) # similarly, we can't update the policy to a different tenant update_policy = {'rbac_policy': {'target_tenant': 'bob'}} self.assertRaises(ext_rbac.RbacPolicyInUse, self.plugin.update_rbac_policy, self.context, wild_policy['id'], update_policy) # after port anchor is gone, update and delete should pass self.plugin.delete_port(self.context, port['id']) self.plugin.update_rbac_policy( self.context, wild_policy['id'], update_policy) self.plugin.delete_rbac_policy(self.context, wild_policy['id']) # check that policy is indeed gone self.context, wild_policy['id'])
deleted_lines: def test_delete_networkrbac(self): network=net, target_tenant='test-tenant-4') self.plugin.delete_port(self.context, port['id']) self.context, netrbac['id'])

commit_message:
WIP Use role tripleo-modify-image to update containers

This change uses the yum_update task file in ansible role
tripleo-modify-image to update the images instead of the
container-check script.

There is conditional logic to ensure that container-check is still
used in releases queens and older.

Change-Id: I91e093f32228fd21f7fce9e50d339941c4829bc4
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Fix up property names in case of mixed case hostnames

When deploying a stack that containes mixed-case hostnames
the following error might be triggered:
Debug: try 15/20: /usr/sbin/pcs -f
/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20180405-8-1sqw3dc property set
--node TEST-STACK34-controller-1 redis-role=true
Debug: Error: Error: unable to set attribute redis-role
Could not map name=TEST-STACK34-controller-1 to a UUID
while the name in the cluster is test-stack34-controller-1

This used to work pre-bundles because we used the facter provided
$::hostname variable which was lower-cased for us. With bundles we
switched to setting cluster properties from the service bootstrap nodes
and so we used the '<service>_short_node_names' hiera key which might
contain mixed-case hostnames.

In order to fix this we just downcase() the short_node_names hiera
string that we loop on so we can get the same behaviour we had on bare
metal.

Tested on an env with mixed-case hostnames:
[root@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0 keystone]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml rabbitmq_short_node_names
["UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-0",
 "UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-1",
 "UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-2"]

Cluster pcs properties were set correctly:
[root@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0 keystone]# pcs property |grep rabbitmq
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-0: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-1: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-1
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-2: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-2

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ie240b8a4217827dd8ade82479a828817d63143ba
Closes-bug: #1773219
Change-Id: I5bd49c4a1b13b2310f8a1173aa6b86abfa5dab3d
(cherry picked from commit f2484a0bf9e64ff84979abe9b70e7f65957b9d26)
(cherry picked from commit f90011dadbe2599ccf9ff4469bdea93413c6d0d2)

commit_message:
Add opendaylight to collect-logs

Add some simple ODL diagnostics to the collect task,
and add the ODL log directory to the list of collection
locaions. The directory may change to /var/log at some
point in the future.

Change-Id: I37405e41ec0f85249cef87c09c966cbe0f9baddf

commit_message:
ssh: enable PasswordAuthentication for containerized undercloud

We don't expect our operators to have SSH keys setup on the undercloud
node, so we don't want to block the PasswordAuthentication in
sshd_config.

Depends-On: I88b24c82fb3cf2309f45d5d447a9b0c403da7fc9
Change-Id: I10b112e8bffff30879606ddd970dfd3ec67fd9c7
Closes-Bug: #1772519
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/29/571829/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PasswordAuthentication: default: 'no' description: Whether or not disable password authentication type: string tripleo::profile::base::sshd::options: map_merge: - {get_param: SshServerOptions} - default: PasswordAuthentication: {get_param: PasswordAuthentication}

Fix i18n issue

This patch fix some i18n issues in the files v3/volumes.py and
volume/manager.py.

Change-Id: I2a608b6d15187ed1941c5b9267a4e13c0d7f229c

commit_message:
Remove revocation_cache_time & signing_dir

revocation_cache_time & signing_dir are deprecated for removal
because PKI token format is no longer supported.
These options were supposed to be removed in Pike.

Change-Id: I1405da1edeeb17016656f8736957d178b3845ff7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/36/569736/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # DEPRECATED: Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. This option # has been deprecated in the Ocata release and will be removed in the P release. # (string value) # This option is deprecated for removal since Ocata. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. # Reason: PKI token format is no longer supported. #signing_dir = <None> # DEPRECATED: Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). commit_message:
ssh: allow to configure PasswordAuthentication

Allow to override the default PasswordAuthentication parameter (default
is 'no').

Change-Id: I88b24c82fb3cf2309f45d5d447a9b0c403da7fc9
Related-Bug: #1772519

subject: tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 09:48:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_rbac_db_mixin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/48c5c84ee0327e2d6f5239a2e61d3787395635e1', 'message': "tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion

The test was originally implemented in this form as a tempest api test
case, but there is a problem with it being part of tempest suite,
because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and
shouldn't affect other tenants. But sharing a network with everyone (*)
briefly impacts other tenants because they see a new shared network
popping up for a second in their net-list. It is also an issue because
if we are unlucky enough, some other tenant may start an instance
without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

Change-Id: I199f639c95e8ae884ede46404370d7b64da3b309
Needed-By: Iba89a53b2715cf3a9c7485f2089f27d547fea308
Related-Bug: #1753209
(cherry picked from commit 6c772de103e469ad17cdbc6a86ed15655aa6b9cc)
"}]
commit_message:
tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion

The test was originally implemented in this form as a tempest api test
case, but there is a problem with it being part of tempest suite,
because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and
shouldn't affect other tenants. But sharing a network with everyone (*)
briefly impacts other tenants because they see a new shared network
popping up for a second in their net-list. It is also an issue because
if we are unlucky enough, some other tenant may start an instance
without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

Change-Id: I199f639c95e8ae884ede46404370d7b64da3b309
Needed-By: Iba89a53b2715cf3a9c7485f2089f27d547fea308
Related-Bug: #1753209
(cherry picked from commit 6c772de103e469ad17cdbc6a86ed15655aa6b9cc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/76/571676/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion(self): network=net, target_tenant='alice') # a wildcard policy should allow the specific policy to be deleted # since it allows the remaining port wild_policy = self._make_networkrbac(net, '*') wild_policy = self.plugin.create_rbac_policy(self.context, wild_policy) # now that wildcard is the only remaining, it should be subjected # to to the same restriction self.assertRaises(ext_rbac.RbacPolicyInUse, self.plugin.delete_rbac_policy, self.context, wild_policy['id']) # similarly, we can't update the policy to a different tenant update_policy = {'rbac_policy': {'target_tenant': 'bob'}} self.assertRaises(ext_rbac.RbacPolicyInUse, self.plugin.update_rbac_policy, self.context, wild_policy['id'], update_policy) # after port anchor is gone, update and delete should pass self.plugin.delete_port(self.context, port['id']) self.plugin.update_rbac_policy( self.context, wild_policy['id'], update_policy) self.plugin.delete_rbac_policy(self.context, wild_policy['id']) # check that policy is indeed gone self.context, wild_policy['id'])
deleted_lines: def test_delete_networkrbac(self): network=net, target_tenant='test-tenant-4') self.plugin.delete_port(self.context, port['id']) self.context, netrbac['id'])

commit_message:
Migrate to the new Mistral context class

The context sent to actions by Mistral has changed. It is now a class
with the potential to carry more context information - we only use the
security context at present. This updates the context usage to make it
use the security attribute.

Closes-Bug: #1718353
Change-Id: I759a1d7a2da0a978b5b784be9f0e58a549b51e06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/86/506186/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The test was originally implemented in this form as a tempest api test
case, but there is a problem with it being part of tempest suite,
because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and
shouldn't affect other tenants. But sharing a network with everyone (*)
briefly impacts other tenants because they see a new shared network
popping up for a second in their net-list. It is also an issue because
if we are unlucky enough, some other tenant may start an instance
without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

commit_message:
tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion

The test was originally implemented in this form as a tempest api test
case, but there is a problem with it being part of tempest suite,
because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and
shouldn't affect other tenants. But sharing a network with everyone (*)
briefly impacts other tenants because they see a new shared network
popping up for a second in their net-list. It is also an issue because
if we are unlucky enough, some other tenant may start an instance
without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

Change-Id: I199f639c95e8ae884ede46404370d7b64da3b309
Needed-By: Iba89a53b2715cf3a9c7485f2089f27d547fea308
Related-Bug: #1753209
(cherry picked from commit 6c772de103e469ad17cdbc6a86ed15655aa6b9cc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/75/571675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion(self): network=net, target_tenant='alice') # a wildcard policy should allow the specific policy to be deleted # since it allows the remaining port wild_policy = self._make_networkrbac(net, '*') wild_policy = self.plugin.create_rbac_policy(self.context, wild_policy) # now that wildcard is the only remaining, it should be subjected # to to the same restriction self.assertRaises(ext_rbac.RbacPolicyInUse, self.plugin.delete_rbac_policy, self.context, wild_policy['id']) # similarly, we can't update the policy to a different tenant update_policy = {'rbac_policy': {'target_tenant': 'bob'}} self.assertRaises(ext_rbac.RbacPolicyInUse, self.plugin.update_rbac_policy, self.context, wild_policy['id'], update_policy) # after port anchor is gone, update and delete should pass self.plugin.delete_port(self.context, port['id']) self.plugin.update_rbac_policy( self.context, wild_policy['id'], update_policy) self.plugin.delete_rbac_policy(self.context, wild_policy['id']) # check that policy is indeed gone self.context, wild_policy['id'])
deleted_lines: def test_delete_networkrbac(self): network=net, target_tenant='test-tenant-4') self.plugin.delete_port(self.context, port['id']) self.context, netrbac['id'])

commit_message:
[Unity] Add support of removing empty host

Add an option in Unity Cinder driver to customize the removing
of empty host. The option is named `remove_empty_host`. Its
default value is False. When it is set to True, the host will
be removed from Unity after the last LUN is detached from it.

Change-Id: I2d9fad2c977a61f5b26a6449a8e509911eff28e0
Closes-bug: #1768711
(cherry picked from commit f9a9aa5a25688cac86e5dc060a20374e4a29bbef)

Add ansible functional tests on stable-2.6

Ansible uses openstacksdk as of 2.6, so we should also run tests against
the stable-2.6 branch.

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix export path used as volume name

On ONTAP NFS driver, the export path was being used as the volume
name. If the export path is different than the volume name, the
API call to delete files would fail and the driver would invoke
a fallback method that deletes the files manually. This patch fixes
that by finding the correct volume name.

(cherry-picked from commit fd2c17edc0332e20149e1aed652a613f2f90de61)
Change-Id: Ice78889573a36ff5e8873a0d316ddcf180d0263f
Closes-bug: #1690954
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/93/567893/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | NetApp ONTAP NFS (bug 1690954): Fix wrong usage of export path as volume name when deleting volumes and snapshots.

commit_message:
Remove duplicate sample files

We have two locations where we provide sample cinder.conf and
policy.yaml/json files. This cleans up the doc output to only
have one dynamically generated sample for both.

Change-Id: I86305dcedb0e7b0ac905fb95a571f4d933e77a5d

commit_message:
Add descriptions for auth_strategy choices

Starting with oslo.config 5.2.0, provided config choices can
include a description in the generated config sample if one
is provided. Without a description, it states "No description
provided". This adds descriptions to the auth_strategy config
option choices for better clarity.

Change-Id: I39bdefbef1200aaeb029d7aa40389b02b4cdce72

commit_message:
Fix cannot add a column with non-constant default

With newer versions of sqlite tests are failing
on sqlite3.OperationalError : Cannot add a column with
non-constant default. In SQL queries is boolean without
apostrophes which causes sqlite3 error. This fix is
solving this issue by replacing text('false') to
expression.false() from sqlalchemy.sql which is
working correct.

Change-Id: Ia96255a2a61994a18b21acc235931ad03a8501ea
Closes-Bug: #1773123

or not.

However, the get_active_networks_info() method used for

commit_message:
Fix lack of routes for neighbour IPv4 subnets

According to [1], when a network contains more that one IPv4
subnet, they are returned in the 'classless-static-routes'
DHCP option, regardless of whether DHCP is enabled for them
or not.

However, the get_active_networks_info() method used for
synchronizing networks after the dhcp agent restarts filters
subnets with "enable_dhcp=True", which differs from the
get_network_info() method.  This will block VM access to
other VMs in the dhcp disabled subnets, even though they are
in the same network.  This is visible by looking at the "opts"
file before and after a restart.

Change the dhcp agent to ask for all subnets in its
get_active_networks_info() RPC call by adding an
enable_dhcp_filter argument to toggle the behavior, with the
default being True to not break backwards compatibility.

Based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/352530/ by Quan Tian.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125043/

Change-Id: I11ca1d1a603d02587f3b8d4a5a52a96b0587d61f
Closes-Bug: #1652654
(cherry picked from commit 2e34279ec3f4e93a7eca1e89b307fdbeb15b211e)

commit_message:
Fix lack of routes for neighbour IPv4 subnets

According to [1], when a network contains more that one IPv4
subnet, they are returned in the 'classless-static-routes'
DHCP option, regardless of whether DHCP is enabled for them
or not.

However, the get_active_networks_info() method used for
synchronizing networks after the dhcp agent restarts filters
subnets with "enable_dhcp=True", which differs from the
get_network_info() method.  This will block VM access to
other VMs in the dhcp disabled subnets, even though they are
in the same network.  This is visible by looking at the "opts"
file before and after a restart.

Change the dhcp agent to ask for all subnets in its
get_active_networks_info() RPC call by adding an
enable_dhcp_filter argument to toggle the behavior, with the
default being True to not break backwards compatibility.

Based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/352530/ by Quan Tian.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125043/

Change-Id: I11ca1d1a603d02587f3b8d4a5a52a96b0587d61f
Closes-Bug: #1652654
(cherry picked from commit 2e34279ec3f4e93a7eca1e89b307fdbeb15b211e)

Remove usage of ordereddict

already declares compatibility only with 2.7.

commit_message:
Add periodic tips jobs

Add jobs to the periodic queue that run the glanceclient unit tests
against the master of various libraries we consume so that we don't
have to wait for a release to detect a change that could be
problematic.

subject: Revert "Remove win32/nt checks for wrapper script gen"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-31 15:05:44.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/packaging.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/pbr/commit/ee26945cb3b290983a4b6d71bec2ed5aaf163989', 'message': 'Revert "Remove win32/nt checks for wrapper script gen"

This reverts commit 07de844615eaec520d817558462cda5f91f9b7b8.
The output console_scripts generated after this commit landed are no
longer directly callable from windows machines. Prior to the this
reverts we wrapped console_script entrypoints in a .exe on windows so
you could directly execute them, just like on *nix systems. However,
after the commit we are no longer generating callables on windows.
Instead PBR generates a txt file, without a suffix, that is not a valid
executable on windows. It is exactly the same output as on a *nix
system, but this neglects that scripts with shebangs don't work on
windows. (For example generated output on windows see [1]) The exe files
were needed so that we could directly execute the console scripts on
windows. This commit restores this functionality so that PBR will
properly generate executable console_scripts on windows machines again.

Closes-Bug: #1761134
[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/722389/

Change-Id: Ifc13879b7f64650d444e3a14df1a53b2172828e4
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Remove win32/nt checks for wrapper script gen"

This reverts commit 07de844615eaec520d817558462cda5f91f9b7b8.
The output console_scripts generated after this commit landed are no
longer directly callable from windows machines. Prior to the this
reverts we wrapped console_script entrypoints in a .exe on windows so
you could directly execute them, just like on *nix systems. However,
after the commit we are no longer generating callables on windows.
Instead PBR generates a txt file, without a suffix, that is not a valid
executable on windows. It is exactly the same output as on a *nix
system, but this neglects that scripts with shebangs don't work on
windows. (For example generated output on windows see [1]) The exe files
were needed so that we could directly execute the console scripts on
windows. This commit restores this functionality so that PBR will
properly generate executable console_scripts on windows machines again.

Closes-Bug: #1761134
[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/722389/

Change-Id: Ifc13879b7f64650d444e3a14df1a53b2172828e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/03/571503/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add workaround for openstack-manila-ui plugin

The openstack-manila-ui package in RDO doesn't include the python plugin
scripts in its enabled directory as they are moved rather than copied
into /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/.

This change copies the plugins into the manila_ui python package
directory before they are removed from /usr/share.

Change-Id: Ia9f941b8272199028e69836514984b33b474c057
Closes-Bug: #1774175

commit_message:
Adding apply_cells to nova-manage to enable automated cells_v2
configuration.

This adds a new apply_cells method to the nova-manage commands that
reads in a specification file (json or yaml) and sets up the
configurations based on the specifications within the file. This
feature matches cell_mappings to specifications based on its name and
will "make-it-so" for cell_mappings by:
* create_cell (spec exists with a name not already in cell_mappings),
* update_cell (spec and mapping exist, but have different values),
* delete_cell (spec file does not have a matching cell by name).

There is a --dry-run argument that can be used to see what would change
without actually performing any modifications.

This should allow automated systems that want to source control (git or
inventory generated) how their cells are setup and managed.

Change-Id: I4bdaf24fc88cf9312a4818bcc5b51047dad02dc0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/572216/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import osimport yamlfrom oslo_utils import strutils @action_description( _("Takes a file with a list of cell specifications and applies it to " "the system. This matches cells by name, creates cells that do " "not exist, updates matched cells where information has changed, " "and deletes cells that are not within this list. The result " "returns the max return code from all of the functions it " "performed.")) @args('--cell-specs-file', metavar='<path_to_specs_file>', help=_("A json or yaml list of cell specifications that contain: " "name (used as the unique key to the cell), " "database_connection, transport_url, disabled. Sample " "file: "''' [ { "name": "cell0", "database_connection": "<database_connection_url0>", "transport_url": null, "disabled": false }, { "name": "cell1", "database_connection": "<database_connection_url1>", "transport_url": "<transport_url1>", "disabled": false }, { "name": "cell2", "database_connection": "<database_connection_url2>", "transport_url": "<transport_url2>", "disabled": true } ]''')) @args('--dry-run', action='store_true', help=_('When set, simply outputs what changes would have been ' 'performed without actually applying the changes.')) @args('--verbose', action='store_true', help=_('More verbose output depending on sub-functions called.')) @args('--force', action='store_true', help=_('Force changes where applicable. This is forwarded on to ' 'this class sub-functions that use it (Default False)')) def apply_cells(self, cell_specs_file=None, verbose=False, dry_run=False, force=False): """Reads a cell spec file and applies specs until cell mappings match. :param cell_specs_file: The file to read the cell specifications from. :param verbose: More verbose output depending on sub-functions called. :param dry_run: Run this in "test" mode showing changes but not applying them. :param force: Apply force for functions requesting it (delete_cell) :return: The maximum return result of all of the sub-functions that were called while synchronizing cells to match the specifications. """ if not cell_specs_file: print(_('Must specify --cell-specs-file as a path to a ' 'file with a json or yaml list of cells.')) return 1 if not os.path.exists(cell_specs_file): print(_('The path specified by --cell-specs-file does not exist.')) return 1 # Retrieve all the specs, validate and index by name required_fields = ['name', 'database_connection', 'transport_url'] specs = self._parse_json_or_yaml(cell_specs_file) specs_by_name = {} err = 0 for spec in specs: for field in required_fields: if field not in spec: err = 1 print('The required field %s is missing from a row in ' '--cell-specs-file' % field) specs_by_name[spec['name']] = spec if err: return 1 # Retrieve existing cells, validate, and index by name cell_mappings = objects.CellMappingList.get_all( context.get_admin_context()) cells_by_name = {} for cell_mapping in cell_mappings: name = getattr(cell_mapping, 'name') if name is None: # TODO(wwriverrat) Can we find a match without raising error? # This will be a common occurrence for those who have used # simple cell setup and the initial cell's name is not set print(_("Error - Existing cell_mapping missing name found. " "Have discovered an existing cell without a name." "This apply_cells function attempts to map your " "specification by name and does not know how to " "handle existing cells without names. Please consider " "calling the cell_v2 update command against any " "existing unnamed cells (ideally matching your spec " "if the cell already exists.")) return 1 else: cells_by_name[cell_mapping.name] = cell_mapping # Use python set functions to determine high-level differences adds = set(specs_by_name).difference(cells_by_name.keys()) similars = set(specs_by_name).intersection(cells_by_name.keys()) deletes = set(cells_by_name).difference(specs_by_name.keys()) result = 0 total_changes = 0 # TODO(wwriverrat) Consider starting txn here and commit when done? # New cells. Add them. for name in adds: cell_spec = specs_by_name[name] if dry_run: print(_("Would have created cell %(name)s with details: " "%(msk)r") % {'name': name, 'msk': self._masked_cell_spec(cell_spec)}) else: add_result = self.create_cell( name=cell_spec['name'], database_connection=cell_spec['database_connection'], transport_url=cell_spec['transport_url'], verbose=verbose, disabled=strutils.bool_from_string(cell_spec['disabled'])) print(_("Create cell %(res)s creating cell %(name)s: %(msk)r") % {'res': 'failed' if add_result else 'succeeded', 'name': name, 'msk': self._masked_cell_spec(cell_spec)}) result = max(result, add_result) total_changes += 1 # Cell exists but needs to compare all fields to see if updates needed for name in similars: cell_mapping = cells_by_name[name] cell_spec = specs_by_name[name] changed = False diff_fields = required_fields + ['disabled'] for field in diff_fields: field_changed = getattr(cell_mapping, field) != cell_spec.get(field, None) if field_changed: if field in ['database_connection', 'transport_url']: val_cell = mask_passwd_in_url(getattr(cell_mapping, field)) val_spec = mask_passwd_in_url(cell_spec.get(field)) else: val_cell = getattr(cell_mapping, field) val_spec = cell_spec.get(field) print(_('For cell %(name)s, field %(fld)s does not match: ' 'cell value (%(valc)s) is not same as spec value ' '(%(vals)s)') % {'name': cell_mapping.name, 'fld': field, 'valc': val_cell, 'vals': val_spec}) changed = changed or field_changed if changed: if dry_run: print(_("Would have updated cell %(name)s from %(pre)r " "to %(post)r") % {'name': name, 'pre': self._masked_cell_mapping(cell_mapping), 'post': self._masked_cell_spec(cell_spec)}) else: # Need to update existing record disabled = strutils.bool_from_string( cell_spec.get('disabled', 'false')) update_result = self.update_cell( cell_mapping.uuid, name=cell_mapping.name, transport_url=cell_spec['transport_url'], db_connection=cell_spec['database_connection'], disable=disabled, enable=not disabled) print(_("Update cell %(res)s modifying cell %(name)s: " "%(msk)r") % {'res': 'failed' if update_result else 'succeeded', 'name': name, 'msk': self._masked_cell_spec(cell_spec)} ) result = max(result, update_result) total_changes += 1 else: print(_("Cell and spec for %s matches. Nothing to do.") % name) # Cells not in the spec get deleted for name in deletes: cell_mapping = cells_by_name[name] if dry_run: print(_("Would have deleted cell %(name)s with details: " "%(msk)r") % {'name': name, 'msk': self._masked_cell_mapping(cell_mapping)}) else: delete_result = self.delete_cell(cell_mapping.uuid, force=force) if delete_result == 0: print(_("Successfully deleted cell %(name)s: %(msk)r") % {'name': name, 'msk': self._masked_cell_mapping(cell_mapping)}) else: print(_("Attempt to delete cell %(name)s (uuid %(uuid)s) " "returned unsuccessful response %(delres)i. " "You may wish to review and remove all mappings " "within that cell and try again.") % {'name': name, 'uuid': cell_mapping.uuid, 'delres': delete_result}) result = max(result, delete_result) total_changes += 1 if total_changes: print(_("There were %(tot)i changes applied to your cells. You " "should consider restarting services that depend on this " "cell data being up to date (i.e. nova-scheduler, etc).") % {'tot': total_changes}) else: print(_("No changes applied. Your cells are all in sync. Yippee!")) return result @staticmethod def _masked_cell_mapping(cell_mapping): return { 'uuid': cell_mapping.uuid, 'name': cell_mapping.name, 'database_connection': mask_passwd_in_url( cell_mapping.database_connection), 'transport_url': mask_passwd_in_url(cell_mapping.transport_url), 'disabled': cell_mapping.disabled, } @staticmethod def _masked_cell_spec(cell_info): db = cell_info.get('database_connection', None) xport = cell_info.get('transport_url', None) return { 'name': cell_info.get('name', None), 'database_connection': None if not db else mask_passwd_in_url(db), 'transport_url': None if not xport else mask_passwd_in_url(xport), 'disabled': cell_info.get('disabled') } @staticmethod def _parse_json_or_yaml(file_location): """Parse the raw contents of a data file. Parses the contents of a file which can be in either yaml or json format. Both can be parsed as yaml. :param file_location: A string containing a path to a file of json or yaml format. :returns: The file contents converted to python objects. """ try: with open(file_location) as fh: parsed = yaml.safe_load(fh) except yaml.YAMLError as e: raise ValueError(six.text_type(e)) return parsed or []

commit_message:
Fix handling of 'cinder_encryption_key_id' image metadata

The Cinder code that processes Glance image metadata
is a bit confused about whether this particular field
is a Glance property or metadata.

Since it isn't a defined a Glance property and is stored
in image metadata, ensure that Cinder also tracks it
metadata and not as a property.

This mismatch prior to this fix causes Cinder to create
volumes with the wrong encryption key when creating a
volume from an encrypted image, which results in an
unreadable volume.

Closes-Bug: #1764125
Change-Id: Ie5af3703eaa82d23b50127f611235d86e4104369

commit_message:
Update tests to use Juju storage

Due to changes to the ceph-osd charm, it is
suggested to use Juju storage for testing.

Change-Id: I329a99ea20879224f90384a8f50eecc76f5fb2ad
Related-Bug: #1698154

commit_message:
Update tests to use Juju storage

Due to changes to the ceph-osd charm, it is
suggested to use Juju storage for testing.

Change-Id: If7bef11c272eb0d00f21678540491ee1621ccc5a
Related-Bug: #1698154
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceilometer-agent refs/changes/37/572137/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from charmhelpers.core.decorators import retry_on_exception @retry_on_exception(num_retries=5, base_delay=1) openstack_release=None, api_version=2): if api_version == 3 or (openstack_release and openstack_release >= 11): api_version = 3 else: client_class = keystone_client.Client
deleted_lines: openstack_release=None): api_version = 2 client_class = keystone_client.Client if openstack_release and openstack_release >= 11: api_version = 3

commit_message:
DNM|WIP: TLS for Ingress

TODO: tune and test the charts.  now is just an intermediary checkin
as a version control.

Adding Ingress TLS for the following services' ingress controller:

* nova
* neutron
* glance
* heat
* cinder

Change-Id: I1c5056141721371f38b8f41e2fd11d9e2d784123
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/61/571361/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ -f "/tmp/certs/ca.pem" && -f "/tmp/certs/ca-key.pem" ]]; then KEY=$(cat /tmp/certs/ca-key.pem | base64 | tr -d '\n') CRT=$(cat /tmp/certs/ca.pem | base64 | tr -d '\n') OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_GLANCE+=" --set endpoints.image.auth.ingress.tls.crt=${CRT}" OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_GLANCE+=" --set endpoints.image.auth.ingress.tls.key=${KEY}" OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_GLANCE+=" --set endpoints.image_registry.auth.ingress.tls.crt=${CRT}" OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_GLANCE+=" --set endpoints.image_registry.auth.ingress.tls.key=${KEY}" fi

commit_message:
Fix doc autoscaling_ceilometer aodh alarm create error

This patch fix aodh create not support type, aodh type 'threshold'
was remove. See remove patch link:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539329/

Aodh alarm create doc link:
https://docs.openstack.org/aodh/pike/admin/telemetry-alarms.html

Change-Id: Icee39f32d69ea96eda8e68d0b121ec12ef05eee6
Closes-Bug: 1754547
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/04/572004/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --type gnocchi_resources_threshold --name cpu-high \ --metric cpu_util --threshold 70 --comparison-operator gt \ --description 'instance running hot' --evaluation-periods 1 \ --aggregation-method mean --alarm-action $ALRM_URL01 \ --granularity 600 --repeat-actions False \
deleted_lines: -t threshold --statistic avg --name cpu-high \ -m cpu_util --threshold 70 --comparison-operator gt \ --period 60 --evaluation-periods 1 \ --alarm-action $ALRM_URL01 \ --repeat-actions False \

commit_message:
Create api+scenario tests for l7policies

This patch implements l7policy tests for the Octavia
Tempest Plugin.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571997/
Change-Id: I58061cd69704da80e48c0963b6639ff8d6051c01
Story: 2001387

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

We've removed support for cinder v1 [1] and v2 [2].  The service catalog

RequestContext.

Also, 'block-storage' is the official service type for cinder [3], so we
want to start supporting service catalogs with an entry for it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/409904
[2] https://review.openstack.org/501874
[3] https://github.com/openstack/service-types-authority/blob/671b42dda721d95f1719be3f376c950a020ede8c/service-types.yaml#L68

Change-Id: I8360b2a05e982285ad852aa475f1e1cd953c2c8b

commit_message:
Update cinder in RequestContext service catalog

We've removed support for cinder v1 [1] and v2 [2].  The service catalog
entries for 'volume' and 'volumev2' are therefore no longer needed in
RequestContext.

Also, 'block-storage' is the official service type for cinder [3], so we
want to start supporting service catalogs with an entry for it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/409904
[2] https://review.openstack.org/501874
[3] https://github.com/openstack/service-types-authority/blob/671b42dda721d95f1719be3f376c950a020ede8c/service-types.yaml#L68

Change-Id: I8360b2a05e982285ad852aa475f1e1cd953c2c8b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/510947/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {u'type': u'volumev3', u'name': u'cinderv3'}, {u'type': u'block-storage', u'name': u'cinder'}, volume_catalog = [{u'type': u'volumev3', u'name': u'cinderv3'}, {u'type': u'block-storage', u'name': u'cinder'}]
deleted_lines: {u'type': u'volume', u'name': u'cinder'}, volume_catalog = [{u'type': u'volume', u'name': u'cinder'}]

commit_message:
Only add internal_api_virtual_ip if InternalApi is in network_data

Add's a conditional to only include internal_api_virtual_ipi
if InternalApi network is defined in custom networks.

Closes-Bug: 1772124
Change-Id: I332355dc63c414aa411b3c1e09dc950b54d5d175

commit_message:
Restore rabbit driver ssl config option

The driver option is necessary as the transport_url query param override
requires a value. Default will be to use the rpc setting and an update
to the driver options will be needed to control ssl for RPC and Notify
independently.

Change-Id: I21afaefe4bc81aee13dc68cdb299333edea17667

commit_message:
Restore rabbit driver ssl config option

The driver option is necessary as the transport_url query param
override requires a value. Default will be to use the rpc setting
and an update to the driver options will be needed to control ssl
for RPC and Notify independently.

Change-Id: Icb2deb30b61c1b19c5573d025fa68342a3cf64e4

commit_message:
Enable Hacking H104 rule

According to [1] files with no code shouldnt contain any license header
or comments, and must be left completely empty. This patch cleaups the
code and enables H104 checking in the tox 'pep8' environment.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/latest/user/hacking.html#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I2528af3579b0426fff24796e94978fcba5001f6e

subject: Move database creation into role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 18:04:49.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/sahara_db_setup.yml', 'examples/playbook.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_sahara/commit/337371f69d79fc1dee4218696755b552c9c32bc4', 'message': "Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'sahara_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable sahara_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I594ef44b2943dc9d7a45771bd1e8592595bd0efc
"}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'sahara_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable sahara_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I594ef44b2943dc9d7a45771bd1e8592595bd0efc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_sahara refs/changes/94/571794/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sahara_db_setup_host: "{{ ('galera_all' in groups) | ternary(groups['galera_all'][0], 'localhost') }}" sahara_galera_address: "{{ galera_address | default('127.0.0.1') }}"
